    3440             : 
    3441             : 
    3442           0 : an_expr_node_ptr glvalue_expr_reusable_copy(
    3443             :                        an_expr_node_ptr             expr,
    3444             :                        a_boolean                    vars_can_change,
    3445             :                        a_reusable_copy_function_ptr copy_func,
    3446             :                        a_boolean                    *temp_init_used,
    3447             :                        a_boolean                    treat_as_potential_prvalue)
    3448             : /*
    3449             : Driver that handles glvalue special cases for making reusable copies of
    3450             : glvalues in both the front end proper and in IL lowering.  Return a
    3451             : copy of the expression tree pointed to by expr, which is a glvalue.
    3452             : If the expression has side effects, or if its meaning is affected by
    3453             : the values of variables and vars_can_change is TRUE, the original
    3454             : expression will be changed so that some part of it is stored in a
    3455             : temporary, and the copy will reference the temporary.  *temp_init_used
    3456             : is returned TRUE if a temporary was used, including a reuse of an
    3457             : existing temporary.  When it is TRUE, the caller must take steps to
    3458             : ensure that expr is evaluated before the copy.  copy_func points to a
    3459             : function that does a copy for prvalues and for simple glvalues (ones
    3460             : whose address can be taken); it's actually what defines the code for
    3461             : storing to a temporary and reusing it, and the decision on which cases
    3462             : should use a temporary.  This function rewrites glvalues whose address
    3463             : cannot be taken, for example bit-field references, into simpler forms
    3464             : before calling the lower-level copy routine.  treat_as_potential_prvalue
    3465             : is TRUE in cases where the eventual value category of expr is not yet known
    3466             : (and can make a difference in determining whether or not the expression
    3467             : is invariant).  treat_as_potential_prvalue should always be FALSE when
    3468             : called during lowering (as value category is known at that time).
    3469             : */
    3470             : {
    3471           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy = NULL;
    3472             : 
    3473           0 :   *temp_init_used = FALSE;
    3474           0 :   expr = skip_parens(expr);
    3475           0 :   check_assertion(is_glvalue_node(expr) || is_error_node(expr));
    3476           0 :   if (is_bit_field_expr(expr)) {
    3477             :     /* You can't take the address of a bit field, so break it down
    3478             :        to underlying glvalues whose addresses can be taken. */
    3479           0 :     an_expr_operator_kind op;
    3480           0 :     an_expr_node_ptr      operand1, operand2, operand3;
    3481           0 :     an_expr_node_ptr      operand1_copy, operand2_copy, operand3_copy;
    3482           0 :     a_boolean             local_temp_init_used;
    3483           0 :     check_assertion(is_operation_node(expr));
    3484           0 :     op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
    3485           0 :     operand1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
    3486           0 :     operand2 = operand1->next;
    3487           0 :     if (is_bit_field_extract_node(expr)) {
    3488             :       /* For a bit-field selection, make a reusable copy of the struct
    3489             :          address, then add the bit field selection to that. */
    3490           0 :       if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_dot_field) {
    3491           0 :         operand1_copy = glvalue_expr_reusable_copy(operand1, vars_can_change,
    3492             :                                                    copy_func,
    3493             :                                                    temp_init_used,
    3494             :                                                    treat_as_potential_prvalue);
    3495             :       } else {
    3496           0 :         check_assertion(op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_points_to_field);
    3497           0 :         operand1_copy = copy_func(operand1, vars_can_change, temp_init_used,
    3498             :                                   treat_as_potential_prvalue);
    3499             :       }  /* if */

    3506             :          and a new "?" that uses the reusable copies. */

    3508           0 :       vars_can_change |= node_has_side_effects(expr, (a_boolean *)NULL);
    3509           0 :       operand1_copy = copy_func(operand1, vars_can_change, temp_init_used,
    3510             :                                 treat_as_potential_prvalue);
    3511             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING
    3512             :       if (il_lowering_underway &&
    3513             :           op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question) {
    3514             :         /* We are producing a lowered eok_question and modifying an existing

    3539           0 :       operand2 = operand1->next;

    3541           0 :       expr_copy = glvalue_expr_reusable_copy(operand2, vars_can_change,
    3542             :                                              copy_func,
    3543             :                                              temp_init_used,
    3544             :                                              treat_as_potential_prvalue);
    3545             :       /* Note that the result is not a comma expression. */
    3546             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    3547           0 :     } else if (gpp_mode && is_gnu_min_max_operator(op)) {

    3549             :          of both operands. */
    3550           0 :       vars_can_change |= node_has_side_effects(expr, (a_boolean *)NULL);
    3551           0 :       operand1_copy = glvalue_expr_reusable_copy(operand1, vars_can_change,
    3552             :                                                  copy_func,
    3553             :                                                  &local_temp_init_used,
    3554             :                                                  treat_as_potential_prvalue);
    3555           0 :       if (local_temp_init_used) *temp_init_used = TRUE;
    3556           0 :       operand2_copy = glvalue_expr_reusable_copy(operand2, vars_can_change,
    3557             :                                                  copy_func,
    3558             :                                                  &local_temp_init_used,
    3559             :                                                  treat_as_potential_prvalue);
    3560           0 :       if (local_temp_init_used) *temp_init_used = TRUE;

    3563           0 :       check_assertion(!expr->is_xvalue);

    3568             :     }  /* if */
    3569             :   } else {
    3570             :     /* For non-bit-field cases, use the simple copy. */
    3571           0 :     expr_copy = copy_func(expr, vars_can_change, temp_init_used,
    3572             :                           treat_as_potential_prvalue);
    3573             :   }  /* if */
    3574           0 :   return expr_copy;
    3575             : }  /* glvalue_expr_reusable_copy */
    3576             : 
    3577             : 
    3578           0 : static an_expr_node_ptr make_glvalue_expr_reusable_copy(
    3579             :                                    an_expr_node_ptr expr,
    3580             :                                    a_boolean        vars_can_change,
    3581             :                                    a_boolean        *temp_init_used,
    3582             :                                    a_boolean        treat_as_potential_prvalue)
    3583             : /*
    3584             : Return a copy of the expression tree pointed to by expr, which is a
    3585             : glvalue.  If the expression has side effects, or if its value is affected
    3586             : by the values of variables and vars_can_change is TRUE, the original
    3587             : expression will be changed so that some part of it is stored in a temporary,
    3588             : and the copy will reference the temporary.  *temp_init_used is returned
    3589             : TRUE if a temporary was used, including a reuse of an existing temporary.
    3590             : When it is TRUE, the caller must take steps to ensure that expr is evaluated
    3591             : before the copy.  treat_as_potential_prvalue is TRUE in cases where the
    3592             : eventual value category of expr is not yet known (and can make a
    3593             : difference in determining whether or not the expression is invariant).
    3594             : See make_lvalue_reusable_copy_full for a similar routine used in IL
    3595             : lowering.
    3596             : */
    3597             : {
    3598           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr expr_copy;
    3599             : 
    3600           0 :   expr_copy = glvalue_expr_reusable_copy(expr, vars_can_change,
    3601             :                                         make_expr_reusable_copy,
    3602             :                                         temp_init_used,
    3603             :                                         treat_as_potential_prvalue);
    3604           0 :   return expr_copy;
    3605             : }  /* make_glvalue_expr_reusable_copy */
    3606             : 
    3607             : 
    3608           0 : void clone_operand(an_operand *operand,
    3609             :                    an_operand *operand_clone,
    3610             :                    a_boolean  vars_can_change,
    3611             :                    a_boolean  *temp_init_used,
    3612             :                    a_boolean  treat_as_potential_prvalue)
    3613             : /*
    3614             : Make a clone of the operand "operand" and put it in "operand_clone".
    3615             : The cloning process copies the subtrees of the operand, e.g., if it's
    3616             : an expression, a separate copy of the expression is made for the
    3617             : operand clone.  The clone reuses the evaluation of the original
    3618             : expression rather than evaluating it again if it has side effects;
    3619             : *temp_init_used is returned TRUE if a temporary was used (including
    3620             : a reuse of an existing temporary), and the caller must ensure that
    3621             : operand is evaluated before the copy in that case.  vars_can_change
    3622             : is TRUE if values of variables might change due to code executed
    3623             : between the first evaluation and the clone evaluation.  The safe
    3624             : value is TRUE.  treat_as_potential_prvalue is TRUE in cases where
    3625             : the eventual value category of "operand" is not yet known (and can make a
    3626             : difference in determining whether or not the expression is invariant).
    3627             : treat_as_potential_prvalue should always be FALSE when called during
    3628             : lowering (as value category is known at that time).
    3629             : */

    3932             :   /* Note that the saved list is going to be used only for rescan purposes,
    3933             :      never directly.  So given that rescan mines its input to effectively
    3934             :      reconstruct source, a lot of the information in the saved list will
    3935             :      never be used.  For example, saved ref entries in the operands in
    3936             :      the list would never be reactivated and then completed.  Also, if
    3937             :      some of the operands are modified (e.g., to add implicit conversions)
    3938             :      during the prototype instantiation, that doesn't matter; the rescan
    3939             :      process knows to skip stuff like that.  To possibly belabor the
    3940             :      point: the operands in the saved list are "used" only once, in
    3941             :      the prototype instantiation; they may thereafter be the basis of a
    3942             :      rescan multiple times, but they will never be "used" again. */
    3943           0 :   make_braced_init_list_operand(icp, &operand);

    3981      239394 : void record_operator_position_in_rescan_info(

    3988             : rescan information associated with the expression attached to operand.

    3990             : information will need to be allocated).  operator_position_2 can be used

    4010             : 
    4011         150 : void record_typed_operator_position_in_expr_rescan_info(

    4048        1471 : void record_cast_position_in_expr_rescan_info(

    4052             :                                              a_type_ptr        cast_type)

    4103       11938 : void record_cast_position_in_rescan_info(an_operand         *operand,
    4104             :                                          an_expr_node_ptr   orig_operand_expr,

    4107             :                                          a_source_position  *type_position,
    4108             :                                          a_type_ptr         cast_type)
    4109             : /*
    4110             : Record the source position of a cast in the rescan information
    4111             : associated with that cast, allocating the rescan info if needed.
    4112             : operand is the cast expression; source_form indicates its source form;
    4113             : start_position is the source position of the start of the cast;
    4114             : type_position is the source position of the type within the cast; and
    4115             : cast_type is the type cast to.  Do nothing if the operand is not
    4116             : discernibly a cast expression.  orig_operand_expr is the expression
    4117             : for the operand before the cast was applied, used to detect cases where
    4118             : nothing was added for the cast.  For casts that will always add
    4119             : something, or when the original operand was not an expression (e.g.,
    4120             : it was a constant), it can be NULL.
    4121             : */

    4126             :                                                    operand);

    4129             :                                                type_position, cast_type);
    4130             :     }  /* if */
    4131             :   }  /* if */
    4132       11938 : }  /* record_cast_position_in_rescan_info */

    4172        6031 : an_expr_node_ptr strip_implicit_operations_for_rescan(
    4173             :                                          an_expr_node_ptr              expr,
    4174             :                                          an_expr_rescan_info_entry_ptr *periep)
    4175             : /*
    4176             : Strip compiler-generated operations (e.g., implicit casts) from the top of
    4177             : the given expression and return the underlying expression.  This is used
    4178             : as part of rescanning expressions in template deduction to redo semantic
    4179             : analysis.  This function strips things that don't have a source
    4180             : counterpart and therefore shouldn't be rescanned.  If periep is non-NULL,
    4181             : then *periep is set to point to the rescan information on the lowest node
    4182             : that has it.
    4183             : */
    4184             : {
    4185        6031 :   if (periep != NULL) {
    4186        3120 :     if (expr->rescan_info != NULL) {
    4187        3120 :       *periep = expr->rescan_info;
    4188             :     } else {
    4189           0 :       *periep = NULL;
    4190             :     }  /* if */
    4191             :   }  /* if */
    4192       10925 :   for (;;) {
    4193             :     /* This routine is similar to find_primary_cast_node. */
    4194       10925 :     if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
    4195       10229 :       if ((expr->variant.operation.compiler_generated &&
    4196        5335 :            is_cast_operation_node(expr)) ||
    4197             :           expr->variant.operation.implicit_step_of_explicit_cast) {
    4198             :         /* Implicit cast -- keep stripping. */
    4199        4894 :         expr = expr->variant.operation.operands;
    4200         441 :       } else if (expr->variant.operation.is_conversion_call &&
    4201             :                  expr->variant.operation.compiler_generated) {
    4202             :         /* A call that implements an implicit conversion.  Go to the
    4203             :            second operand (the input to the conversion function). */
    4204           0 :         expr = expr->variant.operation.operands;
    4205           0 :         check_assertion(expr->next != NULL && expr->next->next == NULL);
    4206             :         expr = expr->next;
    4207             :       } else {
    4208         441 :         switch (expr->variant.operation.kind) {
    4209             :           case eok_reference_to:
    4210             :           case eok_ref_indirect:
    4211             :           case eok_array_to_pointer:
    4212             :           case eok_lvalue:
    4213             :           case eok_lvalue_adjust:
    4214             :           case eok_class_rvalue_adjust:
    4215             :           case eok_unbox_lvalue:
    4216             :             /* These operations are always implicit.  Keep stripping. */
    4217             :             break;
    4218             :           case eok_parens:

    4247             :       /* Explicit casts are retained. */
    4248           0 :       if (!is_generated_dynamic_init(dip)) goto end_of_loop;

    4269             : 
    4270        2741 : an_expr_rescan_info_entry_ptr get_expr_rescan_info(
    4271             :                                         an_expr_node_ptr          expr,
    4272             :                                         an_expr_rescan_info_entry *rescan_info)
    4273             : /*
    4274             : Extract the rescan_info pointer from the indicated expression node and
    4275             : return it.  If the node does not have recorded rescan information, see if
    4276             : there is default information available in the expression stack from
    4277             : an enclosing expression with rescan info, use that to build default
    4278             : rescan information (containing basically just positions) in *rescan_info,
    4279             : and return a pointer to that.  If default information is needed and
    4280             : rescan_info is NULL or no default information is available, abort.
    4281             : */
    4282             : {
    4283        2741 :   an_expr_rescan_info_entry_ptr eriep = expr->rescan_info, default_eriep;
    4284             :

    4287             :        on the nearest enclosing expression that has it. */

    4291             :                         expr_stack->default_rescan_info != NULL,
    4292           0 :                         "missing default rescan info");

    4303             : 
    4304         379 : void make_rescan_operand_full(
    4305             :                              an_expr_node_ptr         expr,
    4306             :                              a_rescan_control_block   *rcblock,
    4307             :                              a_local_expr_options_set local_options,
    4308             :                              an_operand               *operand,
    4309             :                              an_operand               *bound_function_selector)
    4310             : /*
    4311             : As part of redoing semantic analysis on an expression while doing template
    4312             : deduction, convert expr (an operand of the expression currently being
    4313             : processed) to an_operand form in *operand.  rcblock provides context
    4314             : information for the deduction being done, e.g., the template argument list.
    4315             : local_options provides some options, in particular information about
    4316             : the immediate parent operator.  Note that the process here includes
    4317             : making a copy, so the operand returned will never use any part of the
    4318             : original expression, and the original expression is not modified.  If
    4319             : bound_function_selector is non-NULL, the caller is willing to accept a
    4320             : bound function as the result, and the selector for that can be stored
    4321             : in *bound_function_selector.
    4322             : */
    4323             : {
    4324         379 :   an_expr_node_ptr              orig_expr = expr;
    4325         379 :   an_expr_node_ptr              expr_copy = NULL;
    4326         379 :   a_boolean                     copy_error = FALSE, rescanned_case = FALSE;
    4327         379 :   a_constant_ptr                constant = local_constant();
    4328         379 :   a_constant_ptr                alloc_con;
    4329         379 :   an_expr_rescan_info_entry_ptr eriep;
    4330         379 :   an_expr_rescan_info_entry     rescan_info;
    4331             : 
    4332             :   /* Drop implicit operations like conversions, since they don't have a
    4333             :      source counterpart. */
    4334         379 :   expr = strip_implicit_operations_for_rescan(expr, &eriep);
    4335         379 :   if (eriep == NULL) {
    4336           0 :     eriep = get_expr_rescan_info(expr, &rescan_info);
    4337             :   }  /* if */
    4338         379 :   if (rcblock->error_detected) {
    4339             :     /* For speed, stop substituting if there was a deduction error on
    4340             :        a previous operand. */
    4341           0 :     copy_error = TRUE;
    4342         379 :   } else if (expr_is_rescannable(expr)) {
    4343             :     /* Rescan the expression.  Note that going this route rather than through
    4344             :        copy_template_param_expr allows us to keep the rescanned expression
    4345             :        in an_operand form rather than having to convert it to an expression
    4346             :        and then back again. */
    4347             :     /* Pass orig_expr in case the rescan information is on one of the
    4348             :        implicit operations stripped above. */
    4349         294 :     rescan_expr_with_substitution_internal(orig_expr, rcblock,
    4350             :                                            local_options,
    4351             :                                            operand, bound_function_selector);
    4352         294 :     rescanned_case = TRUE;
    4353             :   } else {
    4354             :     /* Copy the expression with substitution. */
    4355          85 :     expr_copy = copy_template_param_expr(expr,
    4356             :                                          rcblock->template_arg_list,
    4357             :                                          rcblock->template_param_list,
    4358             :                                          (a_type_ptr)NULL,
    4359          85 :                                          &eriep->saved_operand.position,
    4360             :                                          rcblock->options,
    4361             :                                          &copy_error,
    4362             :                                          rcblock->ctws_state,
    4363             :                                          constant,
    4364             :                                          &alloc_con);
    4365             :   }  /* if */
    4366         379 :   if (copy_error) {
    4367           0 :     subst_fail(rcblock->error_detected);
    4368           0 :     make_error_operand(operand);
    4369           0 :     copy_operand_position(&eriep->saved_operand, operand);
    4370             :   } else {
    4371         379 :     if (rescanned_case) {
    4372             :       /* The operand was already built above. */
    4373             :     } else {
    4374          85 :       if (expr_copy == NULL) {
    4375             :         /* The result is a constant, so return a constant operand. */
    4376          85 :         if (alloc_con != NULL) {
    4377          85 :           make_constant_operand(alloc_con, operand);
    4378             :         } else {
    4379           0 :           make_constant_operand(constant, operand);
    4380             :         }  /* if */
    4381             :       } else {
    4382             :         /* Return an expression operand. */
    4383           0 :         make_lvalue_or_rvalue_expression_operand(expr_copy, operand);
    4384             :       }  /* if */
    4385          85 :       if (is_any_reference_type(operand->type)) {
    4386           0 :         add_reference_indirection(operand);
    4387             :       }  /* if */
    4388             :     }  /* if */
    4389             :     /* The information in the rescan info was saved for this moment, when
    4390             :        we can use it to restore operand information that would not otherwise
    4391             :        survive in the IL.  Do that now. */
    4392         379 :     if (operand->is_operand_of_address_of) {
    4393             :       /* For indefinite functions with an implied "&", restore just the
    4394             :          position information, because the original operand may have been
    4395             :          for a "&" operator, and wouldn't have all the identifier-form
    4396             :          flags. */
    4397           0 :       check_assertion(is_indefinite_function_operand(operand));
    4398           0 :       copy_operand_position(&eriep->saved_operand, operand);
    4399             :     } else {
    4400             :       /* Normal case: restore everything. */
    4401         379 :       restore_operand_info_from_expr_rescan_info_entry(operand, eriep);
    4402             :     }  /* if */
    4403             :   }  /* if */
    4404         379 :   release_local_constant(&constant);
    4405         379 : }  /* make_rescan_operand_full */
    4406             :

    4421         147 : static void get_rescan_operator_positions(
    4422             :                         an_expr_rescan_info_entry_ptr eriep,
    4423             :                         a_source_position             *operator_position,
    4424             :                         a_token_sequence_number       *operator_tok_seq_number,

    4426             : /*
    4427             : Extract position information from the rescan info pointed to by eriep and
    4428             : return it in operator_position, operator_tok_seq_number, and (if it's
    4429             : non-NULL) operator_position_2.

    4438             : 
    4439             : 
    4440         147 : static void check_incomplete_return_type_allowed_for_rescan(
    4441             :                                                        an_expr_node_ptr  expr)
    4442             : /*
    4443             : The operands of expr have been extracted ("rescanned"), and semantic analysis
    4444             : is about to be redone for the operation represented by expr itself.  If this
    4445             : operation is the top-level operation of a decltype operation, set
    4446             : expr_stack->allow_call_with_incomplete_return_type to TRUE/
    4447             : */
    4448             : {
    4449         147 :   if (expr_stack->is_type_operator_arg_expression) {

    4456             : 
    4457           0 : void make_rescan_operands(a_rescan_control_block  *rcblock,
    4458             :                           an_operand              *operand_1,
    4459             :                           an_operand              *operand_2,
    4460             :                           an_operand              *operand_3,
    4461             :                           a_source_position       *operator_position,
    4462             :                           a_token_sequence_number *operator_tok_seq_number,
    4463             :                           a_source_position       *operator_position_2)
    4464             : /*
    4465             : As part of redoing semantic analysis on an expression while doing template
    4466             : deduction, extract the operands of the expression given by rcblock->expr
    4467             : (an enk_operation or enk_builtin_operation node) and return them as operand_1,
    4468             : operand_2, and operand_3 (unneeded operands are set to NULL; the caller can use
    4469             : that also to rescan only selected operands, e.g., skip operand 1 but rescan
    4470             : operands 2 and 3).  Also return the operator position and operator token
    4471             : sequence number in *operator_position and *operator_tok_seq_number.  If
    4472             : operator_position_2 is non-NULL, return a secondary operator position (if any)
    4473             : in *operator_position_2.  rcblock also gives context information for the
    4474             : template deduction being done, e.g., the template argument list being tried.
    4475             : */
    4476             : {
    4477           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr              expr = rcblock->expr, op1, op2, op3;
    4478           0 :   an_expr_rescan_info_entry_ptr eriep;
    4479           0 :   an_expr_rescan_info_entry     rescan_info;
    4480           0 :   a_boolean                     is_operation;
    4481           0 :   a_boolean                     allow_call_with_incomplete_return_type;
    4482             : 
    4483           0 :   check_assertion(expr != NULL);
    4484             :   /* If a call is embedded in an operation, it cannot be allowed to have an
    4485             :      incomplete return type, unless that operation is a comma operation and
    4486             :      call is the second operand (see below). */

    4488           0 :                            expr_stack->allow_call_with_incomplete_return_type;
    4489           0 :   expr_stack->allow_call_with_incomplete_return_type = FALSE;
    4490           0 :   is_operation = is_operation_node(expr);
    4491           0 :   check_assertion(is_operation ||
    4492             :                   expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_builtin_operation);
    4493           0 :   eriep = get_expr_rescan_info(expr, &rescan_info);
    4494           0 :   op1 = is_operation ? expr->variant.operation.operands
    4495           0 :                      : expr->variant.builtin_operation.operands;

    4499           0 :       local_options |= EOPT_OPERAND_OF_ADDRESS_OF;
    4500             :     }  /* if */

    4525         147 : void make_call_rescan_operands(
    4526             :                               a_rescan_control_block  *rcblock,
    4527             :                               an_operand              *operand,
    4528             :                               an_operand              *bound_function_selector,
    4529             :                               a_source_position       *operator_position,
    4530             :                               a_token_sequence_number *operator_tok_seq_number,
    4531             :                               a_source_position       *closing_paren_position)
    4532             : /*
    4533             : As part of redoing semantic analysis on an expression while doing template
    4534             : deduction, extract the operands of the call expression given by rcblock->expr
    4535             : and return the function to call as *operand, and the bound function selector
    4536             : (if any) as *bound_function_selector.  Also return the operator position and
    4537             : operator token sequence number, and the position of the closing ")",
    4538             : in *operator_position, *operator_tok_seq_number, and *closing_paren_position.
    4539             : rcblock also gives context information for the template deduction
    4540             : being done, e.g., the template argument list being tried.
    4541             : rcblock->argument_list is set to the start of the argument list for

    4543             : */

    4545         147 :   an_expr_node_ptr              expr = rcblock->expr, op1, args;

    4548         147 :   check_assertion(expr != NULL && is_operation_node(expr));
    4549             :   /* We pass NULL for the second argument because we want to require
    4550             :      explicit rescan information on all calls. */
    4551         147 :   eriep = get_expr_rescan_info(expr, (an_expr_rescan_info_entry *)NULL);
    4552         147 :   op1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
    4553         147 :   make_rescan_operand_full(op1, rcblock, EOPT_NO_OPTIONS,
    4554             :                            operand, bound_function_selector);
    4555         147 :   args = op1->next;
    4556             :   /* A call like p->f(x) where the p->f part was treated as a static
    4557             :      selection during prototype instantiation (because we didn't know what
    4558             :      function f would be selected) might on a rescan produce a bound
    4559             :      function for the first operand.  If that doesn't happen, then
    4560             :      we might still have a call we did classify as having a selector,
    4561             :      and for those we have to extract the selector from the second operand
    4562             :      and bind it to the first operand. */
    4563         147 :   if (operand->bound_function) {
    4564           0 :     check_assertion(node_operator_is(expr, eok_call));
    4565             :   } else {
    4566         147 :     if (!node_operator_is(expr, eok_call)) {
    4567             :       /* For calls other than eok_call, rescan the selector and bind it to

    4575             :                                 operator_tok_seq_number,
    4576             :                                 closing_paren_position);

    4625           0 : a_boolean is_uuidof_expr(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
    4626             :                          a_boolean        *is_type,
    4627             :                          an_expr_node_ptr *op_expr,
    4628             :                          a_type_ptr       *type)
    4629             : /*
    4630             : Return TRUE if the indicated expression is the IL that represents a
    4631             : Microsoft __uuidof construct, i.e., a "*" operator on top of a constant
    4632             : that gives the address of a GUID for a uuidof.  When TRUE if returned,
    4633             : *is_type is returned TRUE to indicate the __uuidof is applied to a type

    4704           0 : void make_sizeof_et_al_rescan_operands(
    4705             :                               a_rescan_control_block  *rcblock,
    4706             :                               a_boolean               *p_is_type,
    4707             :                               an_operand              *operand,
    4708             :                               a_type_ptr              *p_type,
    4709             :                               a_source_position       *operator_position,
    4710             :                               a_token_sequence_number *operator_tok_seq_number,
    4711             :                               a_source_position       *type_position)
    4712             : /*
    4713             : As part of redoing semantic analysis on an expression while doing
    4714             : template deduction, extract the operands of the expression given by
    4715             : rcblock->expr (a sizeof, alignof, uuidof, typeid, or noexcept node) and:
    4716             : 
    4717             : 1)  Set *p_is_type indicating whether the operator is applied to a type (TRUE)
    4718             :     or an expression (FALSE).
    4719             : 2)  For the expression case, set *operand to the rescanned expression.
    4720             : 3)  For the type case, set *p_type to the substituted type and *type_position
    4721             :     to the source position of the type.
    4722             : 
    4723             : Also return the operator position and operator token sequence number
    4724             : in *operator_position and *operator_tok_seq_number.  rcblock also gives
    4725             : context information for the template deduction being done, e.g., the
    4726             : template argument list being tried.
    4727             : */
    4728             : {
    4729           0 :   a_boolean                     is_type;
    4730           0 :   a_type_ptr                    type;
    4731           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr              expr = rcblock->expr, op_expr;
    4732           0 :   an_expr_rescan_info_entry_ptr eriep;
    4733           0 :   an_expr_rescan_info_entry     rescan_info;
    4734             : 
    4735           0 :   check_assertion(expr != NULL);
    4736           0 :   eriep = get_expr_rescan_info(expr, &rescan_info);
    4737           0 :   if (is_uuidof_expr(expr, &is_type, &op_expr, &type)) {
    4738             :     /* The expression represents a __uuidof. */
    4739           0 :   } else if (expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_sizeof ||
    4740             :              expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_alignof) {
    4741             :      /* sizeof or alignof in expression form. */
    4742           0 :     is_type = expr->variant.sizeof_info.is_type;
    4743           0 :     if (is_type) {
    4744           0 :       type = expr->variant.sizeof_info.variant.type;
    4745             :     } else {
    4746           0 :       op_expr = expr->variant.sizeof_info.variant.expr;
    4747             :     }  /* if */
    4748           0 :   } else if (expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_typeid) {
    4749             :      /* typeid in expression form. */
    4750           0 :     op_expr = expr->variant.typeid_info.expr;
    4751           0 :     is_type = (op_expr == NULL);
    4752           0 :     if (is_type) {
    4753           0 :       type = expr->variant.typeid_info.type;
    4754             :     }  /* if */
    4755           0 :   } else if (is_operation_node(expr) &&
    4756           0 :              node_operator_is(expr, eok_noexcept)) {
    4757             :     /* noexcept in expression form. */
    4758           0 :     op_expr = expr->variant.operation.operands;
    4759           0 :   } else if (is_constant_node(expr)) {
    4760             :     /* tpck_sizeof, tpck_alignof, tpck_typeid, or tpck_noexcept constant form.
    4761             :        tpck_uuidof gets handled above and doesn't get here. */
    4762           0 :     a_constant_ptr con = node_constant(expr);
    4763           0 :     check_assertion(constant_is(con, ck_template_param) &&
    4764             :                     (con->variant.template_param.kind ==
    4765             :                                 (a_template_param_constant_kind)tpck_sizeof ||
    4766             :                      con->variant.template_param.kind ==
    4767             :                                 (a_template_param_constant_kind)tpck_alignof ||

    4769             :                                 (a_template_param_constant_kind)tpck_typeid ||

    4771             :                                 (a_template_param_constant_kind)tpck_noexcept)

    4776           0 :       type = con->variant.template_param.variant.templ_sizeof.type;
    4777             :     }  /* if */
    4778             :   } else {

    4780             :   }  /* if */
    4781           0 :   *p_is_type = is_type;
    4782           0 :   if (is_type) {
    4783             :     /* Type case.  Do substitution on the type. */
    4784           0 :     if (type == NULL) {
    4785             :       /* For __uuidof(0), the type is NULL. */
    4786           0 :       *p_type = NULL;
    4787             :     } else {
    4788           0 :       *p_type = do_type_substitution_for_rescan(type, rcblock, eriep);
    4789             :     }  /* if */
    4790             :   } else {
    4791             :     /* Expression case.  Rescan the operand. */
    4792           0 :     make_rescan_operand(op_expr, rcblock, operand);
    4793           0 :     *p_type = NULL;
    4794             :   }  /* if */
    4795           0 :   get_rescan_operator_positions(eriep, operator_position,
    4796             :                                 operator_tok_seq_number,

    4801           0 : an_expr_node_ptr arg_list_from_dyn_init(a_dynamic_init_ptr dip)
    4802             : /*
    4803             : Return the effective argument list of the indicated dynamic initialization,
    4804             : to be used for expression rescan purposes.  The effective argument list is
    4805             : the initializer expression or the arguments of the constructor call.
    4806             : */
    4807             : {
    4808           0 :   a_constant_ptr   con;
    4809           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr args = NULL;
    4810             : 
    4811           0 : top_of_routine:
    4812           0 :   switch (dip->kind) {
    4813             :     case dik_none:
    4814             :     case dik_zero:
    4815             :       /* No arguments in these cases. */
    4816             :       args = NULL;
    4817             :       break;
    4818           0 :     case dik_expression:
    4819             :     case dik_class_result_via_ctor:
    4820             :       /* The single expression is the argument. */
    4821           0 :       args = dip->variant.expression;
    4822           0 :       break;
    4823           0 :     case dik_constructor:
    4824             :       /* The constructor call argument list is the argument list. */
    4825           0 :       args = dip->variant.constructor.args;
    4826           0 :       break;
    4827           0 :     case dik_nonconstant_aggregate:
    4828             :       /* This is okay if it's a repeated initialization for an array,
    4829             :          e.g., a default constructor call for each element. */
    4830           0 :       con = dip->variant.constant;

    4840           0 :       unexpected_condition_str("unexpected dynamic init kind");
    4841           0 :     case dik_bitwise_copy:

    4843             :         args = dip->variant.bitwise_copy.source;
    4844             :       } else {
    4845           0 :         unexpected_condition_str("unexpected dynamic init kind");
    4846             :       }  /* if */
    4847             :       break;
    4848           0 :     case dik_constant:
    4849             :       /* This can happen if the constant was folded. */
    4850           0 :       args = dip->variant.constant->expr;
    4851           0 :       break;
    4852           0 :     default:

    4854             :   }  /* switch */
    4855           0 :   return args;

    4859           0 : void make_cast_rescan_operands(a_rescan_control_block *rcblock,

    4865             :                                a_dynamic_init_ptr     *actual_dip,
    4866             :                                an_operand             *operand,
    4867             :                                an_operand             *bound_function_selector)
    4868             : /*
    4869             : As part of redoing semantic analysis on an expression while doing
    4870             : template deduction, extract the operand of the cast expression given
    4871             : by rcblock->expr and return it in *operand.  (If dip != NULL, use that
    4872             : as the cast instead of rcblock->expr.)  Also return the type cast to in
    4873             : *cast_type, the starting position of the cast in *start_position, and
    4874             : the position of the type in the cast in *type_position.  If
    4875             : bound_function_selector is non-NULL, the caller is willing to accept a
    4876             : bound function, and *bound_function_selector can be set to the
    4877             : selector part of that.  If rcblock->operator_token is tok_typename,
    4878             : indicating a functional-notation type conversion (or an old-style cast
    4879             : or compound literal), *operand and *bound_function_selector are not
    4880             : used; the argument list for the cast is returned in
    4881             : rcblock->argument_list instead (there might be more than one
    4882             : argument).  If the cast was initialized by a braced-init-list
    4883             : (including for compound literals), return a copied/substituted
    4884             : list in *braced_init_list (a single entry that is a braced list)
    4885             : instead of returning *operand and *bound_function_selector.
    4886             : If actual_dip != NULL, *actual_dip is set to point to the actual
    4887             : dynamic init that underlies the cast, or NULL if there isn't one.
    4888             : */
    4889             : {
    4890           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr              expr = rcblock->expr, op1 = NULL;
    4891           0 :   an_expr_rescan_info_entry_ptr eriep;
    4892           0 :   a_token_sequence_number       operator_tok_seq_number;
    4893           0 :   a_type_ptr                    orig_type;

    4898             :     /* The cast is specified by a dynamic initialization (dip), not an

    4916             :          conversion of "{}" to S<T>, (2) a call to a user-defined conversion

    5241      110686 : an_expr_node_ptr alloc_node_for_constant_operand(an_operand *operand)
    5242             : /*
    5243             : Allocate an enk_constant expression node for the given constant operand,

    5245             : */

    5252      110686 :   con = &operand->variant.constant;
    5253      110686 :   if (operand->name_reference_set &&
    5254       28933 :       con->kind == (a_constant_repr_kind)ck_ptr_to_member) {

    5256             :        Transfer the name reference information to the allocated constant. */

    5259           0 :       obj =
    5260             :          (a_source_correspondence *)con->variant.ptr_to_member.variant.routine;
    5261             :     } else {

    5263             :            (a_source_correspondence *)con->variant.ptr_to_member.variant.field;
    5264             :     }  /* if */
    5265             :     /* The object pointer is NULL for NULL pointers-to-members. */

    5267           0 :       copy_constant(con, local_con);
    5268           0 :       local_con->variant.ptr_to_member.name_reference =

    5270           0 :       con = local_con;
    5271             :     }  /* if */

    5273      110686 :   node = alloc_node_for_constant(con);
    5274      110686 :   copy_operand_position_to_expr(operand, node);
    5275      110686 :   if (is_an_lvalue(operand)) {

    5282             : 
    5283             : 
    5284      363200 : static an_expr_node_ptr extract_node_from_operand(an_operand *operand)
    5285             : /*
    5286             : Extract an expression from an operand.  If the operand contains a
    5287             : constant, allocate a constant node and copy the constant value to it.
    5288             : If the operand is an error operand, create an error node.  If the
    5289             : operand is an expression, return the expression node.  This routine
    5290             : does not preserve information from the operand as extra information
    5291             : added to the expression and should be used when the expression is
    5292             : either (a) going to be simply tested or traversed for some property,
    5293             : and not saved, or (b) going to be immediately put back into
    5294             : an_operand, with the original operand information restored via a call
    5295             : to restore_operand_details.  Otherwise, use make_node_from_operand
    5296             : instead.
    5297             : */
    5298             : {
    5299      363200 :   an_expr_node_ptr node = NULL;
    5300             : 
    5301      363200 :   switch (operand->kind) {
    5302           0 :     case ok_error:
    5303             :       /* Make an error node.  Its type will be error. */
    5304           0 :       node = error_node();
    5305           0 :       break;
    5306      252514 :     case ok_expression:
    5307             :       /* Just return the node in the operand. */
    5308      252514 :       node = operand->variant.expression;
    5309      252514 :       break;
    5310      110686 :     case ok_constant:
    5311             :       /* Create a constant node and copy the constant in the operand to the
    5312             :          node. */
    5313      110686 :       node = alloc_node_for_constant_operand(operand);
    5314      110686 :       break;
    5315           0 :     case ok_braced_init_list:
    5316           0 :       node = make_braced_init_expr_from_arg_list_elem(
    5317             :                                            operand->variant.braced_init_list);
    5318           0 :       break;
    5319           0 :     default:
    5320           0 :       unexpected_condition_str(
    5321             :              "extract_node_from_operand: converting unexpected operand kind");
    5322             :   }  /* switch */
    5323      363200 :   return node;
    5324             : }  /* extract_node_from_operand */
    5325             : 
    5326             :

    5825       46974 : a_boolean in_potential_constant_constexpr_context(void)
    5826             : /*
    5827             : Return TRUE if we're inside the definition of a C++11 constexpr function or
    5828             : constructor, including the header, and we're in an expression that is not
    5829             : required to be constant in the definition but might be constant in an
    5830             : invocation of the function, e.g., the return expression.  Used to avoid

    5833             : folding of C++14 constexpr functions is done using the interpreter.)

    5846             :   }  /* if */

    5851       33619 : a_boolean call_did_not_fold_to_constant(a_routine_ptr     routine,

    5972       20567 : static a_boolean expr_fold_constexpr_call(an_expr_node_ptr  call_expr,
    5973             :                                           a_source_position *pos,
    5974             :                                           an_operand        *result,
    5975             :                                           a_diag_list_ptr   diag_list)
    5976             : /*
    5977             : Interface to interpret_constexpr_call for use within the expression-processing
    5978             : routines.  Attempts to fold the call call_expr to a constant; if it
    5979             : can, sets result to an operand for the result and returns TRUE.  Otherwise,
    5980             : leaves result unchanged and returns FALSE (potentially adds diagnostic nodes
    5981             : in *diag_list).  pos is the source position of the call.
    5982             : */

    5984       20567 :   a_boolean folded = FALSE;

    5989        2219 :     folded = interpret_constexpr_call(call_expr, result_con, diag_list);

    5992          88 :       result->position = *pos;

    5994           0 :         a_boolean is_rvalue_ref = is_rvalue_reference_type(result->type);

    6539           0 : static void change_to_error_operand(an_operand *operand)
    6540             : /*
    6541             : Take an existing operand and convert it to an error operand.  Retain
    6542             : some information, like source position.  This routine can be used
    6543             : to "neuter" an operand, in particular to detach it from its subtree without
    6544             : freeing the subtree; there is no implication that there was an error.
    6545             : See conv_to_error_operand for the usual case.
    6546             : */
    6547             : {
    6548           0 :   set_operand_kind(operand, (an_operand_kind)ok_error);
    6549           0 :   operand->type = error_type();
    6550           0 :   operand->state = (an_operand_state)os_none;
    6551           0 :   operand->is_simple_string_literal = FALSE;
    6552           0 :   operand->is_id_expression = FALSE;
    6553           0 :   operand->is_address_of_id_expression = FALSE;
    6554             :   /* bound_function is not cleared on purpose. */
    6555           0 :   operand->selector_is_object_pointer = FALSE;
    6556           0 :   operand->is_operand_of_address_of = FALSE;
    6557           0 :   operand->has_required_ptr_to_member_form = FALSE;
    6558           0 : }  /* change_to_error_operand */
    6559             :

    6572             : 
    6573           0 : void normalize_error_operand(an_operand *operand)
    6574             : /*
    6575             : Take an operand for which is_error_operand returns TRUE, and normalize it.
    6576             : For operands that have an error type but not an ok_error kind, that means
    6577             : converting them to full error operands.

    7052         719 : void add_base_class_casts(a_base_class_ptr  bcp,

    7060             :                           a_source_position *err_pos,
    7061             :                           a_boolean         *error_detected)
    7062             : /*
    7063             : Add casts to *p_node to change its type from (a pointer to) a class type to
    7064             : (a pointer to) a base class of that class; bcp indicates the base class
    7065             : and qualifiers_model indicates the qualifiers to be placed on that class
    7066             : type.  *p_node can be a prvalue pointer to class, or a class lvalue,
    7067             : xvalue, or rvalue.  In C++/CLI mode, it can also be a handle to a class.
    7068             : qualifiers_model is a potentially cv-qualified class type.  Access
    7069             : control is done on the cast if check_cast_access is TRUE.  Checking for an
    7070             : ambiguous base class is done if check_ambiguity is TRUE.  allow_ambiguity
    7071             : controls whether the diagnostic that is issued for an ambiguity is a warning
    7072             : or an error.  is_implicit_cast is TRUE if the cast is implicit.
    7073             : implicit_in_naming is TRUE for casts that are generated implicitly in
    7074             : referencing a member of a class (roughly, in getting from the name used in
    7075             : the source -- the projection symbol -- to the member actually used in the
    7076             : IL).  *err_pos indicates a source position to be used for errors.  If
    7077             : error_detected is non-NULL, return *error_detected set to TRUE if
    7078             : there was an error, and do not issue any diagnostics (including
    7079             : warnings).  Note that calls from outside the expression-processing
    7080             : routines must specify error_detected != NULL.  For calls from inside,
    7081             : this routine does handle suppression of errors in deduction contexts
    7082             : appropriately and error_detected can be NULL.

    7430           0 :              any_virtual_steps_in_derivation(bcp)) {
    7431             :     /* The base class is a virtual base of the derived class, or there's a
    7432             :        virtual step on the derivation path. */
    7433           0 :     if (expr_error_should_be_issued()) {
    7434           0 :       pos_ty2_error(ec_pm_derived_class_from_virtual_base, err_pos,
    7435             :                     new_class_pointed_to, bcp->type);
    7436             :     }  /* if */
    7437           0 :     *p_node = error_node();
    7438             :   } else {
    7439           0 :     if (check_cast_access) {
    7440             :       /* Check the accessibility of the base class.  (Recall that casts
    7441             :          to derived types can be done implicitly.) */
    7442             :       curr_type = new_class_pointed_to;
    7443           0 :       for (dsp = cast_derivation_path_of(bcp); dsp != NULL; dsp = dsp->next) {
    7444           0 :         base_class = dsp->base_class;

    7446           0 :         if (!is_accessible_imm_base_class(base_class, curr_type, bcp)) {

    7448             :                                        es_discretionary_error,

    7451             :                               ec_conv_from_inaccessible_base_class,
    7452             :                               err_pos, base_class->type);

    7454             :           break;
    7455             :         }  /* if */
    7456           0 :         curr_type = base_class->type;

    7458             :     }  /* if */

    7475             : an_expr_node_ptr add_box_to_expression(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
    7476             :                                        a_boolean        is_implicit,
    7477             :                                        a_boolean        handle_to_form)
    7478             : /*
    7479             : Add a C++/CLI "box" operation to the indicated expression (a prvalue
    7480             : with a boxable CLI value type), and return the boxed expression.  is_implicit
    7481             : is TRUE if the boxing is implicit (as opposed to coming from an explicit cast).

    7505             : might be a derived class of the underlying type of the handle).

    7546             : 
    7547             : static a_boolean expr_is_literal_convertible_to_cli_string(
    7548             :                                                          an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    7549             : /*
    7550             : Return TRUE if the given expression is a string literal, or an expression
    7551             : made up of "?" and "," operations whose leaf value nodes are all string
    7552             : literals, that is convertible to a C++/CLI System::String^.
    7553             : */
    7554             : {
    7555             :   a_boolean is_string_lit = FALSE;
    7556             : 
    7557             :   expr = skip_parens(expr);
    7558             :   if (!literal_type_convertible_to_cli_string(expr->type)) {
    7559             :     /* Wrong type, so look no further. */
    7560             :   } else if (expr_is_pointer_to_string_literal(expr, (a_constant **)NULL)) {
    7561             :     /* The expression is a string literal that has decayed to a pointer. */
    7562             :     is_string_lit = TRUE;
    7563             :   } else if (is_constant_node(expr)) {

    7565             :       /* The node is an undecayed string literal. */

    7567             :     }  /* if */

    7569             :              node_operator_is(expr, eok_question)) {

    7571             :        literals. */

    7578             :     }  /* if */
    7579             :   } else if (is_operation_node(expr) &&
    7580             :              node_operator_is(expr, eok_comma)) {

    7585             :       is_string_lit = TRUE;

    7645             : 
    7646             : static an_expr_node_ptr convert_expr_to_handle_to_cli_string(
    7647             :                                                          an_expr_node_ptr expr)
    7648             : /*
    7649             : Helper function for convert_operand_to_handle_to_cli_string.  Convert
    7650             : the string literals in the given expression to System::Strings.  Return
    7651             : the rewritten expression.

    7654             :   a_constant_ptr   string_constant = local_constant();

    7663             :                                /*address_escapes=*/TRUE)) {

    7727             : 
    7728             : 
    7729             : void convert_operand_to_handle_to_cli_string(an_operand_ptr operand)
    7730             : /*
    7731             : Convert operand (a string literal) to System::String^.  The result will be
    7732             : a constant operand designating an address constant that refers to the input
    7733             : string literal.  Note that such a "constant" actually involves a run-time
    7734             : operation (the allocation and construction of a System::String object in
    7735             : the gc-heap), but this is treated as a compile-time constant by the
    7736             : Microsoft compiler, hence the unusual representation.  Also handles
    7737             : cases where there are string literals under a "?" or "," operator, e.g.,
    7738             : in x ? "abc" : "de" the two string literal nodes are converted to
    7739             : System::String^.  The expression should be one for which
    7740             : is_literal_convertible_to_cli_string is TRUE.
    7741             : */
    7742             : {
    7743             :   a_constant_ptr   string_constant = local_constant();
    7744             :   an_operand       orig_operand;
    7745             :   an_expr_node_ptr expr;
    7746             : 
    7747             : #if EXPENSIVE_CHECKING
    7748             :   check_assertion(is_literal_convertible_to_cli_string(operand,
    7749             :                                                       /*allow_complex=*/TRUE));
    7750             : #endif /* EXPENSIVE_CHECKING */
    7751             :   orig_operand = *operand;
    7752             :   /* Convert lvalue string literals to prvalue pointers. */
    7753             :   do_operand_transformations(operand, TOPT_NO_OPTIONS);
    7754             :   expr = make_node_from_operand(operand);
    7755             :   if (!expr->is_lvalue &&
    7756             :       is_pointer_type(expr->type) &&
    7757             :       constant_prvalue_pointer(expr, string_constant,
    7758             :                                /*address_escapes=*/TRUE)) {
    7759             :     /* The operand is a simple string literal, so make a constant operand
    7760             :        for the corresponding handle. */
    7761             :     string_constant->type = make_handle_to_system_string();
    7762             :     make_constant_operand(string_constant, operand);
    7763             :   } else {
    7764             :     /* Handle cases like x ? "abc" : "de". */
    7765             :     expr = convert_expr_to_handle_to_cli_string(expr);
    7766             :     make_expression_operand(expr, operand);
    7767             :   }  /* if */
    7768             :   restore_operand_details(operand, &orig_operand);
    7769             :   release_local_constant(&string_constant);
    7770             : }  /* convert_operand_to_handle_to_cli_string */
    7771             : 
    7772             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7773             : 
    7774       18639 : void add_cast_to_node(an_expr_node_ptr  *p_node,
    7775             :                       a_type_ptr        new_type,
    7776             :                       a_boolean         check_cast_access,
    7777             :                       a_boolean         check_ambiguity,
    7778             :                       a_boolean         is_implicit_cast,
    7779             :                       a_boolean         is_reinterpret_cast,
    7780             :                       a_boolean         reinterpret_semantics,
    7781             :                       a_source_position *err_pos)
    7782             : /*
    7783             : Add a cast node to the expression tree pointed to by *p_node, and update
    7784             : *p_node to point to the cast node.  The old node is cast to the type new_type.
    7785             : *err_pos gives the source position for errors.  Check access on the
    7786             : cast if check_cast_access is TRUE.  Check for an ambiguous base or
    7787             : derived class if check_ambiguity is TRUE.  If is_implicit_cast is TRUE, this
    7788             : is an implicit cast rather than an explicit one.  This routine generates
    7789             : the special IL operators used for base-->derived and derived-->base class
    7790             : pointer casts, when they are appropriate.  It also issues errors for
    7791             : invalid casts of that kind (e.g., ambiguous).  If reinterpret_semantics
    7792             : is TRUE, those related class casts are not checked for.  is_reinterpret_cast
    7793             : indicates that the cast comes from a reinterpret_cast construct in the source.
    7794             : */
    7795             : {
    7796       18639 :   a_type_ptr       old_type = (*p_node)->type, new_type_pointed_to;
    7797       18639 :   a_boolean        baseward_cast;
    7798       18639 :   a_base_class_ptr bcp;
    7799             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7800             :   an_expr_node_ptr expr;
    7801             :   a_boolean        check_need_for_final_cast = FALSE;
    7802             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7803             : 
    7804             :   /* Make sure the next field of the node is cleared.  The caller must 
    7805             :      make sure it's copied if that's necessary (it can't be done here,
    7806             :      because we can't link a previous expression in a list to this
    7807             :      new expression). */
    7808       18639 :   (*p_node)->next = NULL;
    7809       18639 :   if (!expr_access_checking_should_be_done()) check_cast_access = FALSE;
    7810       18639 :   if (!C_mode() && !reinterpret_semantics &&
    7811       16105 :       related_class_pointers_or_handles(old_type, new_type,
    7812             :                                         &baseward_cast, &bcp)) {
    7813             :     /* C++ cast from a pointer to a class to a pointer to a related
    7814             :        (base or derived) class. */
    7815           0 :     new_type_pointed_to = type_pointed_to(new_type);
    7816           0 :     if (baseward_cast) {
    7817             :       /* Derived --> base.  Valid unless the cast is ambiguous or
    7818             :          the base class is inaccessible. */
    7819           0 :       add_base_class_casts(bcp, new_type_pointed_to,
    7820             :                            check_cast_access, check_ambiguity,
    7821             :                            /*allow_ambiguity=*/FALSE,
    7822             :                            is_implicit_cast,
    7823             :                            /*implicit_in_naming=*/FALSE,
    7824             :                            p_node, err_pos, (a_boolean *)NULL);
    7825             :     } else {
    7826             :       /* Base --> derived.  Valid unless the cast is ambiguous or the base
    7827             :          class is a virtual base of the derived class. */
    7828           0 :       add_derived_class_casts(new_type_pointed_to, bcp, check_ambiguity,
    7829             :                               /*requires_runtime_check=*/FALSE,
    7830             :                               p_node, err_pos, (a_boolean *)NULL);
    7831             :     }  /* if */
    7832       34744 :   } else if (!C_mode() && !reinterpret_semantics &&
    7833       16105 :              related_member_pointers(old_type, new_type, &baseward_cast,
    7834             :                                      &bcp)) {
    7835             :     /* C++ cast from pointer-to-member to pointer-to-member-of-related-class.
    7836             :        Note that the underlying member types may be different. */
    7837           0 :     if (baseward_cast) {
    7838             :       /* Derived --> base (allowed only as an explicit cast).  Valid unless
    7839             :          the cast is ambiguous. */
    7840           0 :       add_pm_base_class_casts(new_type, bcp, check_ambiguity, p_node, err_pos);
    7841             :     } else {
    7842             :       /* Base --> derived (allowed as an implicit or explicit cast).  Valid
    7843             :          unless the cast is ambiguous, the base class is inaccessible (if
    7844             :          the cast is implicit), or the base class is a virtual base of the
    7845             :          derived class. */
    7846           0 :       add_pm_derived_class_casts(new_type, bcp,
    7847             :                                  check_cast_access, check_ambiguity,
    7848             :                                  is_implicit_cast,
    7849             :                                  p_node, err_pos);
    7850             :     }  /* if */
    7851       18639 :   } else if ((!C_mode() || c99_mode || gcc_mode) && is_bool_type(new_type)) {
    7852             :     /* Cast to bool.  Use eok_bool_cast. */
    7853        7323 :     *p_node = make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_bool_cast,

    7858             :              boxing_conversion_possible(old_type, new_type,

    7914             : 
    7915       26479 : void cast_node(an_expr_node_ptr  *p_node,
    7916             :                a_type_ptr        new_type,
    7917             :                a_boolean         check_cast_access,
    7918             :                a_boolean         check_ambiguity,
    7919             :                a_boolean         is_implicit_cast,
    7920             :                a_boolean         is_reinterpret_cast,
    7921             :                a_boolean         reinterpret_semantics,
    7922             :                a_boolean         within_expr_processing,
    7923             :                a_source_position *err_pos)
    7924             : /*
    7925             : Change the type of a node.  If the node is a constant, a conversion is done on
    7926             : the constant value; otherwise a cast operator is added on top of the node
    7927             : (except for implicit casts that have no effect).  Check access on the cast if
    7928             : check_cast_access is TRUE.  Check ambiguity on the cast if check_ambiguity
    7929             : is TRUE.  If is_implicit_cast is TRUE, this is an implicit cast rather
    7930             : than an explicit one.  Warnings about truncation etc. are issued only
    7931             : if is_implicit_cast is TRUE.  is_reinterpret_cast is TRUE if this is
    7932             : a reinterpret_cast in the source; reinterpret_semantics is TRUE if the
    7933             : behavior is the same as a reinterpret_cast (without necessarily having that
    7934             : construct appear in the source).  *err_pos gives the source position for
    7935             : errors.  The current expression is assumed to be a nonconstant
    7936             : expression; if it were a constant expression, we wouldn't have an
    7937             : expression node.  It's also assumed to be an evaluated expression (for
    7938             : purposes of error diagnosis).  The caller must have already determined
    7939             : that the conversion is allowed, except for casts to ambiguous or
    7940             : inaccessible base classes.  This routine does not handle user-defined
    7941             : conversions.  This routine can be called from outside of the expression
    7942             : processing routines; within_expr_processing should be passed as FALSE
    7943             : to indicate that.
    7944             : */
    7945             : {
    7946       26479 :   a_constant_ptr   local_con = local_constant();
    7947       26479 :   a_boolean        did_not_fold;
    7948       26479 :   a_boolean        need_cast;
    7949       26479 :   an_expr_node_ptr node = *p_node;
    7950       26479 :   a_type_ptr       old_type = node->type;
    7951             : 
    7952       52958 :   if (within_expr_processing &&
    7953       26479 :       !expr_access_checking_should_be_done()) {
    7954        6824 :     check_cast_access = FALSE;
    7955             :   }  /* if */
    7956             :   /* Drop any qualifiers on the destination type, as appropriate. */
    7957       26479 :   new_type = prvalue_type(new_type);
    7958             :   /* See whether a cast operator should be added. */
    7959       26479 :   if (!is_implicit_cast) {
    7960             :     /* Explicit casts must always be represented. */
    7961             :     need_cast = TRUE;
    7962             :   } else {
    7963             :     /* An implicit cast: In some cases, such casts have no effect and need
    7964             :        not be represented in the IL. */
    7965       25184 :     if (!cast_identical_types(old_type, new_type)) {
    7966             :       /* The cast is needed since it changes the type of the expression. */ 
    7967             :       need_cast = TRUE;
    7968       18398 :     } else if (is_bit_field_extract_node(node)) {
    7969             :       /* Don't allow dropping a cast to the same type over a bit-field
    7970             :          extraction node, because the node with the cast has different
    7971             :          integral promotion behavior. */
    7972             :       need_cast = TRUE;
    7973             :     } else {
    7974             :       /* An implicit cast with no effect: No cast node should be created. */
    7975             :       need_cast = FALSE;
    7976             :     }  /* if */
    7977             :   }  /* if */
    7978             :   if (!need_cast) {
    7979             :     check_assertion(is_implicit_cast);
    7980             :     /* We don't need to add a cast. */
    7981        8081 :   } else if (m_is_error_type(new_type) ||
    7982        8081 :              (m_is_error_type(old_type) &&
    7983           0 :               is_class_struct_union_type(new_type))) {
    7984             :     /* Casting to an error type changes the node to an error node.
    7985             :        When casting from an error type, avoid creating a cast to a class
    7986             :        type. */
    7987           0 :     *p_node = error_node();
    7988             :   } else {
    7989             :     /* Casting a node to a class type is not allowed. */
    7990             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
    7991             :     check_assertion_str(!is_class_struct_union_type(new_type) ||
    7992             :                         unboxing_conversion_possible(old_type, new_type,
    7993             :                                                      (a_std_conv_descr *)NULL),
    7994             :                         "cast_node: cast to class type");
    7995             : #else /* !MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7996        8081 :     check_assertion_str(!is_class_struct_union_type(new_type),
    7997        8081 :                         "cast_node: cast to class type");
    7998             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
    7999        8081 :     did_not_fold = TRUE;
    8000        8081 :     if (is_constant_node(node)) {
    8001             :       /* Copy the constant to a local copy.  Type-change the local constant
    8002             :          and copy the result to a new constant.  Since we are in a
    8003             :          nonconstant context, reduce any error to a warning and leave
    8004             :          the conversion to be done at runtime. */
    8005           0 :       copy_constant(node_constant(node), local_con);
    8006           0 :       if (within_expr_processing) {
    8007           0 :         expr_type_change_constant(local_con, new_type, is_implicit_cast,
    8008             :                                   check_cast_access,
    8009             :                                   check_ambiguity,
    8010             :                                   reinterpret_semantics,
    8011             :                                   /*maintain_expression=*/FALSE,
    8012             :                                   &did_not_fold,

    8049         260 : void prep_generic_nontype_template_argument(an_operand *operand)

    8134        9131 : void make_unknown_dependent_function_operand(
