   13714        2309 :       do_rvalue_generic_operand_transformations(operand);

   13743       68183 : void prep_generic_operand(an_operand *operand)

   13755             : 
   13756        8824 : void generic_cast_operand(an_operand         *operand,
   13757             :                           a_type_ptr         dest_type,
   13758             :                           a_cast_source_form source_form,
   13759             :                           a_boolean          is_implicit_cast)
   13760             : /*
   13761             : Add a generic cast that casts the given operand to dest_type.  This is used
   13762             : in prototype instantiations to represent conversions to unknown types.
   13763             : source_form identifies the kind of cast (e.g., static_cast, const_cast).
   13764             : is_implicit_cast is TRUE if the cast is implicit.  dest_type is allowed to
   13765             : be a reference type.  Note that the cast can be bizarre in a number of ways,
   13766             : e.g., if the source operand is an lvalue.
   13767             : */
   13768             : {
   13769        8824 :   a_type_ptr orig_dest_type = dest_type;
   13770        8824 :   an_operand orig_operand;
   13771        8824 :   a_boolean  rvalue_expected = FALSE, lvalue_expected = FALSE;
   13772        8824 :   a_boolean  is_reference_cast = is_any_reference_type(dest_type);
   13773        8824 :   a_boolean  is_rvalue_reference_cast = FALSE;
   13774             : 
   13775        8824 :   orig_operand = *operand;
   13776        8824 :   check_assertion(is_template_dependent_context());
   13777             :   /* See whether we know that the operand will be used as an lvalue or
   13778             :      rvalue. */
   13779        8824 :   if (is_reference_cast) {
   13780          48 :     if (is_rvalue_reference_type(dest_type)) {
   13781             :       is_rvalue_reference_cast = TRUE;
   13782             :       rvalue_expected = TRUE;
   13783             :     } else {
   13784           8 :       lvalue_expected = TRUE;
   13785             :     }  /* if */

   13787             :        type, but otherwise replace the reference type with the referenced
   13788             :        type. */

   13790           0 :           typeref_is_type_operator(dest_type))) {

   13792             :     }  /* if */

   13794       10173 :              (is_class_struct_union_type(dest_type) ||

   14137             : an expression is being built from operands whose types are based

   14222       33740 : void do_unary_operation(an_expr_operator_kind   op,
   14223             :                         an_operand              *operand,

   14227             :                         a_token_sequence_number operator_tok_seq_number)
   14228             : /*
   14229             : Perform a unary operation on one operand yielding a result.  op
   14230             : indicates the operation, and operand is the operand.  result_type indicates

   14402           0 : static a_boolean optimizable_class_rvalue_question(
   14403             :                                                  an_operand         *operand_2,
   14404             :                                                  an_operand         *operand_3,
   14405             :                                                  a_dynamic_init_ptr *dip_2,
   14406             :                                                  a_dynamic_init_ptr *dip_3)
   14407             : 
   14408             : /*
   14409             : operand_2 and operand_3 are the second and third operands of a "?"
   14410             : operation that returns a class prvalue.  Check to see whether a copy
   14411             : elision optimization can be applied, and return TRUE if so, with
   14412             : *dip_2 and *dip_3 set to point to the underlying dynamic initialization
   14413             : entries for the operands.
   14414             : */

   14416           0 :   a_boolean optimizable = FALSE;
   14417             :

   14450             : 
   14451           0 : static void do_class_rvalue_question_optimization(a_dynamic_init_ptr dip_2,
   14452             :                                                   a_dynamic_init_ptr dip_3,
   14453             :                                                   an_operand         *result)
   14454             : /*
   14455             : Do the copy elision optimization for a class prvalue "?" operation.
   14456             : optimizable_class_rvalue_question has previously determined that the
   14457             : optimization can be done.  dip_2 and dip_3 point to the dynamic
   14458             : initializations for the temporaries of the operands of the "?", and
   14459             : result is the "?" operation on those operands, without the final
   14460             : temporary initialization.  The necessary initialization is
   14461             : added and result is updated.
   14462             : */
   14463             : {
   14464           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr   expr, temp_init_node;
   14465           0 :   a_dynamic_init_ptr dip;
   14466             : 
   14467             :   /* In the optimized form, the temporary that is the result of the
   14468             :      overall "?" is a dik_expression marked with
   14469             :      is_optimized_class_rvalue_question_mark, which means the expression
   14470             :      pointed to should be evaluated for its effects (mainly, initializing
   14471             :      the top-level temporary) but its value should not be stored into the
   14472             :      temporary.  The initializations for the temporaries for each operand
   14473             :      are linked to the master entry so that they will initialize its
   14474             :      temporary (i.e., the operand initializations become dependent
   14475             :      entries that do not have temporaries of their own), and any
   14476             :      destructions indicated are removed (because they will be done by
   14477             :      the master entry). */
   14478             :   /* Unlink the destructions, as they will not be used. */
   14479           0 :   remove_from_destruction_list(dip_2);
   14480           0 :   remove_from_destruction_list(dip_3);
   14481           0 :   dip_2->destructor = NULL;
   14482           0 :   dip_3->destructor = NULL;
   14483           0 :   dip_2->inside_conditional_expression = FALSE;
   14484           0 :   dip_3->inside_conditional_expression = FALSE;
   14485           0 :   if (strict_ansi_mode) {
   14486             :     /* In strict mode, issue an error if the copy constructor that would
   14487             :        have been called is not accessible. */
   14488           0 :     handle_elided_copy_constructor(result->type,
   14489             :                                    /*elided_cctor=*/(a_routine *)NULL,
   14490             :                                    &result->position);
   14491             :   }  /* if */
   14492             :   /* Make the enk_temp_init node and the dynamic-init entry under it. */
   14493           0 :   temp_init_node = create_expr_temporary(result->type,
   14494             :                                          /*is_lvalue=*/FALSE,
   14495             :                                          /*is_explicit_cast=*/FALSE,
   14496             :                                          /*suppress_abstract_test=*/TRUE,
   14497             :                                          (a_dynamic_init_kind)dik_expression,
   14498             :                                          &result->position,
   14499             :                                          &dip);
   14500           0 :   dip->is_optimized_class_rvalue_question_mark = TRUE;
   14501           0 :   expr = make_node_from_operand(result);
   14502           0 :   set_expr_result_not_used(expr);
   14503           0 :   dip->variant.expression = expr;
   14504           0 :   make_expression_operand(temp_init_node, result);
   14505             :   /* Link the initializations for the operands to the result initialization
   14506             :      so they will use the same temporary. */
   14507           0 :   dip_2->master_entry = dip;
   14508           0 :   dip_3->master_entry = dip;
   14509           0 : }  /* do_class_rvalue_question_optimization */
   14510             : 
   14511             : 
   14512        2347 : void do_question_operation(an_operand        *operand_1,
   14513             :                            an_operand        *operand_2,
   14514             :                            an_operand        *operand_3,
   14515             :                            a_type_ptr        result_type,
   14516             :                            a_boolean         result_is_an_lvalue,
   14517             :                            a_boolean         suppress_class_rvalue_temp,
   14518             :                            a_boolean         suppress_class_temp_optimization,
   14519             :                            a_boolean         template_case,
   14520             :                            a_boolean         is_gnu_two_operand_form,
   14521             :                            a_source_position *question_position,
   14522             :                            a_source_position *colon_position,
   14523             :                            an_operand        *result)
   14524             : /*
   14525             : Build an operand for a "?" operation.  operand_1, operand_2, and operand_3
   14526             : are the operands.  result_type is the result type.  The result is an lvalue
   14527             : if result_is_an_lvalue is TRUE (note that for xvalue cases the result is
   14528             : built here as an lvalue and then changed by the caller to an xvalue, so
   14529             : result_is_an_lvalue will be passed in TRUE).  The operand is built in *result.
   14530             : Constant operations are folded if appropriate.  suppress_class_rvalue_temp
   14531             : is TRUE if the generation of an extra temporary for the result of a class
   14532             : rvalue case should be suppressed.  suppress_class_temp_optimization is TRUE if
   14533             : no attempt should be made to eliminate an unneeded temporary copy for a class
   14534             : rvalue result.  template_case is TRUE if this is a template-dependent case.
   14535             : is_gnu_two_operand_form is TRUE if this is a GNU two-operand "?" (a synthesized
   14536             : operand_2 is still provided).  question_position and colon_position give the
   14537             : position of the "?" and ":".
   14538             : */

   14864       15846 : void add_reference_indirection(an_operand *result)

   15141       46877 : a_boolean is_potentially_constant_valued_variable(a_variable_ptr var)
   15142             : /*
   15143             : Return TRUE if var is a constant variable potentially usable in
   15144             : constant expressions.  Such a variable has non-volatile const integral
   15145             : or enum type, and possibly some other const types in some modes.  In a

   15164       29061 :              is_any_reference_type(var_type)) {

   15183             : 
   15184       35680 : a_constant_ptr var_constant_value_full(a_variable_ptr var,
   15185             :                                        a_boolean      copy_for_reuse,
   15186             :                                        a_boolean      clear_backing_expr,
   15187             :                                        a_boolean      allow_C_mode_const_var)
   15188             : /*
   15189             : If the variable var has a constant initial value, return a pointer to it;
   15190             : otherwise, return NULL.  A variable with an aggregate initial value is
   15191             : considered to have no initial value.  Also, a variable with an address-
   15192             : constant initial value is treated as having a nonconstant initial value.
   15193             : If copy_for_reuse is TRUE, the constant returned will be a copy that
   15194             : can be reused by putting it in an_operand entry and later allocating it;
   15195             : when copy_for_reuse is FALSE, the copy returned can be examined but
   15196             : it should be considered read-only and shouldn't be allowed to survive
   15197             : beyond the short term.  If copy_for_reuse is TRUE and clear_backing_expr
   15198             : is also TRUE, the backing expression pointer will be cleared, if necessary,
   15199             : by copying the constant (otherwise, a copy will not be done merely to clear
   15200             : the backing expression).  If allow_C_mode_const_var is TRUE, a value will
   15201             : be returned for a C mode const variable.
   15202             : */
   15203             : {
   15204       35680 :   a_constant_ptr     con_val = NULL;

   15206       35680 :   an_initializer_ptr init;
   15207             :

   15212             :        instantiated if needed. */

   15449           0 : void make_ptr_to_member_constant_operand(
   15450             :                                     a_symbol_ptr      member_sym,
   15451             :                                     a_symbol_ptr      member_proj_sym,

   15453             :                                     a_source_position *end_position,
   15454             :                                     a_boolean         check_protected_access,
   15455             :                                     a_boolean         is_qualified_name,
   15456             :                                     a_boolean         has_required_ampersand,
   15457             :                                     a_boolean         allow_on_managed,
   15458             :                                     an_operand        *result)
   15459             : /*
   15460             : Make an operand for a constant representing a C++ pointer to member.
   15461             : member_sym is the member (not overloaded, possibly a projection symbol).
   15462             : member_proj_sym is the same as member_sym, or is the overloaded function
   15463             : symbol that contains member_sym, or it can be a projection symbol for
   15464             : either of those.  *position gives the source position to put into the
   15465             : operand.  *end_position gives the end position if end positions are
   15466             : being maintained.  If check_protected_access is TRUE and the symbol is a
   15467             : protected member, do the ARM 11.5 protected member access check.
   15468             : The name that generated this pointer-to-member constant is a qualified
   15469             : name if is_qualified_name is TRUE; it is the immediate operand of a "&"
   15470             : operator (with not even parentheses allowed to intervene) if
   15471             : has_required_ampersand is TRUE.  If member_sym is a member of a
   15472             : C++/CLI managed class, issue an error unless allow_on_managed is
   15473             : TRUE.  If the member is a bit field, issue an error.  
   15474             : */
   15475             : {
   15476           0 :   a_symbol_ptr   base_member_sym = fundamental_symbol_of(member_sym);
   15477           0 :   a_constant_ptr constant = local_constant();
   15478             : 
   15479             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   15480             :   if (cppcli_enabled && !allow_on_managed &&

   15483             :        class. */

   15485             :     make_error_operand(result);

   15487             :   }  /* if */

   15492           0 :     an_error_severity severity = (an_error_severity)es_discretionary_error;

   15495           0 :       severity = strict_ansi_discretionary_severity;

   15497             :       /* g++ doesn't allow the nonstandard forms in any version (tested
   15498             :          in 2.95 through 4.1). */

   15513             :     }  /* if */
   15514             :   }  /* if */
   15515             :   /* Protected members of a base class can only be accessed through an
   15516             :      object of a derived class (ARM 11.5).  Post-ARM revisions have made
   15517             :      it clear this applies also to pointers to members.  We allow the
   15518             :      address of a protected member to be taken as a member of the
   15519             :      derived class but not as a member of the base class.  For example:
   15520             :        class A { protected: int i; };
   15521             :        class B : public A { void mf(); };
   15522             :        void B::mf() {
   15523             :          int A::* pmi = &A::i;      // error - protected member
   15524             :          int B::* pmj = &B::i;      // OK
   15525             :        }

   15527             :      Also skip this check if it shouldn't be done (e.g., because 
   15528             :      an access control error has already been issued for the identifier). */

   15728           0 : void make_upc_thread_operand(an_operand            *operand,
   15729             :                              a_constant_repr_kind  kind)
   15730             : /*

   15732             : ck_upc_threads or ck_upc_mythread.  The position of the current token is
   15733             : used as the operand position.  If the number of threads was specified on

   15788        3039 : a_dynamic_init_ptr alloc_expr_ctor_dynamic_init(
   15789             :                                      a_routine_ptr     ctor_routine,
   15790             :                                      an_expr_node_ptr  args,
   15791             :                                      a_type_ptr        dest_type,
   15792             :                                      a_boolean         static_temp,
   15793             :                                      a_boolean         add_default_args,
   15794             :                                      a_boolean         implied_source,
   15795             :                                      a_boolean         value_init,
   15796             :                                      a_boolean         sequenced_args,
   15797             :                                      a_boolean         fold_constexpr,
   15798             :                                      a_boolean         check_constexpr,
   15799             :                                      a_source_position *pos)
   15800             : /*
   15801             : Allocate a dynamic initialization entry for a constructor call
   15802             : (dik_constructor), and return a pointer to it.  ctor_routine gives the
   15803             : constructor (NULL for a dependent case).  args gives the constructor argument
   15804             : list.  dest_type is the destination type, if there is one (e.g., for a cast),
   15805             : or NULL otherwise.  static_temp is TRUE if the static_temp field of the
   15806             : generated entry should be set to TRUE.  add_default_args is TRUE if the
   15807             : expressions for any default arguments should be added to the end of the
   15808             : argument list.  implied_source is TRUE if the call is a copy constructor call
   15809             : and the source for the copy is implied.  value_init is TRUE if value-
   15810             : initialization is required.  sequenced_args is TRUE if the arguments must be
   15811             : evaluated left-to-right.  pos is the source position of the call (may be
   15812             : omitted if ctor_routine is NULL).  This function does not fill in the
   15813             : destructor information, if any.
   15814             : 
   15815             : If constexpr is enabled and fold_constexpr is TRUE the construction may be
   15816             : folded to a constant (a dik_constant dynamic init entry is returned).  If
   15817             : check_constexpr is also TRUE, diagnostics are emitted in contexts requiring
   15818             : successful folding.
   15819             : */

   16114        2615 : void set_temp_dynamic_init_lifetime(a_dynamic_init_ptr dip)

   16123             :        evaluated but not evaluated.  For potentially-evaluated expressions,

   16163             : 
   16164        3040 : an_expr_node_ptr alloc_temp_init_node(a_type_ptr         temp_type,
   16165             :                                       a_dynamic_init_ptr dip,
   16166             :                                       a_boolean          is_lvalue,
   16167             :                                       a_boolean          is_explicit_cast)
   16168             : /*
   16169             : Create an enk_temp_init node and return a pointer to it.  The implied
   16170             : temporary has type temp_type.  The initialization to be done is pointed
   16171             : to by dip.  The enk_temp_init is an lvalue for the temporary (rather than
   16172             : an value) if is_lvalue is TRUE.  is_explicit_cast is TRUE if this node
   16173             : represents an explicit cast.
   16174             : */
   16175             : {
   16176        3040 :   an_expr_node_ptr         temp_init_node;
   16177        3040 :   a_scope_stack_entry_ptr  ssep = &scope_stack[decl_scope_level];
   16178             : 
   16179        3040 :   temp_init_node = alloc_expr_node((an_expr_node_kind)enk_temp_init);
   16180        3040 :   temp_init_node->variant.init.dynamic_init = dip;
   16181        3040 :   temp_init_node->is_lvalue = is_lvalue;
   16182        3040 :   if (is_lvalue) {
   16183         114 :     temp_init_node->type = temp_type;
   16184             :   } else {
   16185             :     /* The result is the value of the temporary, so the type is the type
   16186             :        of the temporary as a prvalue. */
   16187        2926 :     temp_init_node->type = prvalue_type(temp_type);
   16188             :   }  /* if */
   16189        3040 :   dip->is_explicit_cast = is_explicit_cast;
   16190             :   /* Make sure the IL scope that the temporary is part of exists.  Even though
   16191             :      the temporary does not exist as a variable, it's still (from a language
   16192             :      point of view) part of this scope.  That's important, because it has to
   16193             :      be destroyed at the right point.  (Note, however, that when a temp is
   16194             :      created for a default argument in the context of a function prototype
   16195             :      scope, or a template declaration scope, no IL scope will be created;
   16196             :      that's okay, since the expression will be copied in a context that
   16197             :      will have an IL scope.) */
   16198             :   /* Class reactivation scopes can show up here with severe errors.  Skip to
   16199             :      the logically enclosing context if that's the case. */
   16200        3040 :   while (scope_is(ssep, sck_class_reactivation)) {
   16201           0 :     expect_error();
   16202           0 :     ssep = &scope_stack[ssep->previous_scope];
   16203             :   }  /* if */
   16204        3040 :   if (!scope_is(ssep, sck_func_prototype) &&
   16205        2850 :       !scope_is(ssep, sck_template_declaration) &&
   16206             :       !scope_is(ssep, sck_template_instantiation)) {
   16207        2850 :     (void)ensure_il_scope_exists(ssep);
   16208             :   }  /* if */
   16209             :   /* Put the dynamic initialization on a destruction list if appropriate. */
   16210        3040 :   set_temp_init_dynamic_init_lifetime(temp_init_node);
   16211        3040 :   return temp_init_node;
   16212             : }  /* alloc_temp_init_node */
   16213             : 
   16214             : 
   16215         705 : a_boolean error_on_abstract_class_object(a_type_ptr        object_type,
   16216             :                                          a_source_position *position)

   16219             : abstract class type, issue an error and return TRUE.  Otherwise, return
   16220             : FALSE.
   16221             : */
   16222             : {
   16223         705 :   a_boolean err = FALSE;

   16236        1779 : an_expr_node_ptr create_expr_temporary(
   16237             :                                     a_type_ptr          temp_type,
   16238             :                                     a_boolean           is_lvalue,
   16239             :                                     a_boolean           is_explicit_cast,
   16240             :                                     a_boolean           suppress_abstract_test,
   16241             :                                     a_dynamic_init_kind init_kind,
   16242             :                                     a_source_position   *position,
   16243             :                                     a_dynamic_init_ptr  *dip)
   16244             : /*
   16245             : Create an enk_temp_init node and return a pointer to it.  The implied
   16246             : temporary has type temp_type.  A dynamic initialization entry indicating
   16247             : init_kind initialization (and destruction if appropriate) is attached
   16248             : under the enk_temp_init node, and a pointer to it is returned in *dip.
   16249             : The value of the enk_temp_init is an lvalue (rather than an rvalue) for
   16250             : the temporary if is_lvalue is TRUE.  is_explicit_cast is TRUE if
   16251             : this node represents an explicit cast.  An error is issued if the
   16252             : temporary has an abstract class type unless suppress_abstract_test is
   16253             : TRUE.  *position is the position of the reference.  Used only in C++.
   16254             : When init_kind == dik_constructor, does not expand constexpr calls
   16255             : (it doesn't have the argument list and other info to do so).
   16256             : */
   16257             : {
   16258        1779 :   an_expr_node_ptr temp_init_node;
   16259             : 
   16260             :   /* Allocate the dynamic initialization entry. */
   16261        1779 :   *dip = alloc_dtor_dynamic_init(init_kind, temp_type, position);
   16262        1779 :   if (curr_expr_kind_is_const() && (*dip)->destructor != NULL &&
   16263           0 :       (curr_expr_is_evaluated() || !cpp11_mode)) {
   16264             :     /* An operation with a destruction is not allowed in an evaluated
   16265             :        subexpression of a constant expression (and we would get into
   16266             :        trouble trying to attach the dynamic init to a lifetime). */
   16267           0 :     expr_pos_error(ec_expr_not_constant, position);
   16268           0 :     (*dip)->destructor = NULL;
   16269             :   }  /* if */
   16270             :   /* Make an enk_temp_init node that points at the dynamic init entry. */
   16271        1779 :   temp_init_node = alloc_temp_init_node(temp_type, *dip, is_lvalue,
   16272             :                                         is_explicit_cast);
   16273        1779 :   if (!suppress_abstract_test && !microsoft_bugs) {
   16274             :     /* It's an error to create a temporary of an abstract class type. */
   16275         697 :     (void)error_on_abstract_class_object(temp_type, position);
   16276             :   }  /* if */
   16277        1779 :   return temp_init_node;
   16278             : }  /* create_expr_temporary */
   16279             : 
   16280             : 
   16281       37966 : a_routine_ptr routine_from_function_operand(an_operand *operand)
   16282             : /*
   16283             : operand is the operand identifying the function to call in a normal call
   16284             : (including a virtual call), or some other operand identifying a function.
   16285             : If it is possible to determine the specific function named, return a
   16286             : pointer to its routine entry.  Otherwise, return NULL.  The operand
   16287             : can be an lvalue (function designator) or prvalue pointer to the function,
   16288             : even though calls actually always use the prvalue form.
   16289             : */
   16290             : {
   16291       37966 :   a_routine_ptr  routine = NULL;
   16292             : 
   16293       37966 :   if (is_expression_operand(operand)) {
   16294       25617 :     routine = routine_from_function_expr(operand->variant.expression);
   16295       12349 :   } else if (is_constant_operand(operand) && is_a_prvalue(operand)) {
   16296       12349 :     a_constant_ptr con = &operand->variant.constant;
   16297       12349 :     if (con_is_exact_addr_of_routine(con)) {
   16298             :       /* Constant that is the address of a routine. */
   16299           0 :       routine = con->variant.address.variant.routine;
   16300             :     }  /* if */
   16301             :   }  /* if */
   16302       25617 :   if (routine != NULL && routine->has_deducible_return_type &&
   16303             :       !routine->has_deduced_return_type) {
   16304           0 :     finalize_deduced_return_type(routine, &operand->position);
   16305             :   }  /* if */
   16306       37966 :   return routine;
   16307             : }  /* routine_from_function_operand */
   16308             : 
   16309             : #if OPTIMIZE_VIRTUAL_FUNCTION_CALLS
   16310             : 
   16311             : an_expr_node_ptr retrace_base_casts(an_expr_node_ptr base_cast_node,
   16312             :                                     a_type_ptr       target_class,
   16313             :                                     a_type_ptr       qualifiers_model,
   16314             :                                     an_expr_node_ptr *new_top_of_tree)
   16315             : /*
   16316             : Recursively traverse a tree of base class cast expression nodes, creating and
   16317             : linking a tree of derived class cast expression nodes that is its inverse.
   16318             : That is, given an expression tree representing the casts
   16319             : 
   16320             :     (T1*)(T2*)...(TN*)
   16321             : 
   16322             : where T[n] is a base class of T[n+1], this routine recursively traverses
   16323             : the expression nodes starting with the cast to T1* and produces the tree
   16324             : corresponding to
   16325             : 
   16326             :     (TN*)...(T2*)
   16327             : 
   16328             : base_cast_node is the current node in the traversal; it must be either an
   16329             : eok_base_class_cast node or one or more eok_cast nodes whose operand and
   16330             : target types are the same except for qualification, followed by an
   16331             : eok_base_class_cast node.  target_class is the type at which the scan is
   16332             : to terminate ("TN").  qualifiers_model is a class type whose cv-qualifiers
   16333             : should be used at each cast step (they are the cv-qualifiers we want to end
   16334             : up with on the final result).  new_top_of_tree points to an expression node
   16335             : pointer that will be set to point to the new eok_derived_class_cast node
   16336             : that produces the ultimate type (the cast to "TN*").
   16337             : 
   16338             : If the tree of derived class cast nodes is successfully created, the
   16339             : return value is the newly-created derived class cast node for this level;
   16340             : it will have the compiler_generated flag set to TRUE, and will have no
   16341             : operand (it is the caller's responsibility to set the operand to point
   16342             : to the caller's node or to the original top of the tree).  If the original
   16343             : tree of cast nodes does not satisfy the requirements described above, no
   16344             : derived class cast nodes will be created and the return value will be NULL.
   16345             : 
   16346             : On successful return, *new_top_of_tree points to the top of a sequence
   16347             : of base class casts, and the function result points to the bottom of
   16348             : that sequence, which is a cast that has no operand yet.  The top-most
   16349             : caller will attach that bottom node to the original tree, forming an
   16350             : expression (at *new_top_of_tree) that casts the original expression
   16351             : back to the target_class.  In the recursive calls, this routine adds
   16352             : another cast to the bottom of the list being built up, and returns a
   16353             : pointer to the bottom-most entry.
   16354             : 
   16355             : The casts can also be done on class objects (lvalue or rvalue) in addition
   16356             : to the pointer-to-class case described above.
   16357             : */
   16358             : {
   16359             :   an_expr_node_ptr new_derived_cast_node = NULL;
   16360             :   a_type_ptr       this_node_class;
   16361             :   a_type_ptr       operand_class;
   16362             :   a_boolean        pointer_case = is_pointer_type(base_cast_node->type);
   16363             : 
   16364             :   base_cast_node = skip_parens(base_cast_node);
   16365             :   if (pointer_case) {
   16366             :     /* The object is a pointer to class.  Skip any casts that adjust the
   16367             :        cv-qualifiers. */
   16368             :     while (is_operation_node(base_cast_node) &&
   16369             :            node_operator_is(base_cast_node, eok_cast) &&
   16370             :            is_pointer_type(base_cast_node->type) &&
   16371             :            is_pointer_type(base_cast_node->variant.operation.operands->type)) {
   16372             :       a_type_ptr target_type = type_pointed_to(base_cast_node->type);
   16373             :       a_type_ptr source_type =
   16374             :              type_pointed_to(base_cast_node->variant.operation.operands->type);
   16375             :       target_type = skip_typerefs(target_type);
   16376             :       source_type = skip_typerefs(source_type);
   16377             :       if (identical_types(target_type, source_type)) {
   16378             :         base_cast_node=skip_parens(base_cast_node->variant.operation.operands);
   16379             :       } else {
   16380             :         /* Not a skippable eok_cast node. */
   16381             :         break;
   16382             :       }  /* if */
   16383             :     }  /* while */
   16384             :   } else {
   16385             :     /* The object is a class lvalue or rvalue.  Skip any nodes that adjust
   16386             :        the cv-qualifiers. */
   16387             :     while (is_operation_node(base_cast_node) &&
   16388             :            (node_operator_is(base_cast_node, eok_lvalue_adjust) ||
   16389             :             node_operator_is(base_cast_node, eok_class_rvalue_adjust)) &&
   16390             :            identical_types_ignoring_qualifiers(base_cast_node->type,
   16391             :                                                base_cast_node->variant.
   16392             :                                                    operation.operands->type)) {
   16393             :       base_cast_node = skip_parens(base_cast_node->variant.operation.operands);
   16394             :     }  /* while */
   16395             :   }  /* if */
   16396             :   if (is_operation_node(base_cast_node) &&
   16397             :       node_operator_is(base_cast_node, eok_base_class_cast)) {
   16398             :     /* This is an eok_base_class_cast node, so processing can continue.
   16399             :        Any other kind of node renders the tree impossible to invert and
   16400             :        will result in terminating the traversal and returning NULL
   16401             :        instead of a new derived class cast node. */
   16402             :     a_base_class_ptr base_class;
   16403             :     a_type_ptr       cast_dest_type;
   16404             : 
   16405             :     this_node_class = base_cast_node->type;
   16406             :     if (pointer_case) this_node_class = type_pointed_to(this_node_class);
   16407             :     this_node_class = skip_typerefs(this_node_class);
   16408             :     operand_class = base_cast_node->variant.operation.operands->type;
   16409             :     if (pointer_case) operand_class = type_pointed_to(operand_class);
   16410             :     operand_class = skip_typerefs(operand_class);
   16411             :     cast_dest_type = type_plus_qualifiers_from_second_type(operand_class,
   16412             :                                                            qualifiers_model);
   16413             :     if (pointer_case) cast_dest_type = make_pointer_type(cast_dest_type);
   16414             :     check_assertion(is_immediate_class_type(this_node_class) &&
   16415             :                     is_immediate_class_type(operand_class));
   16416             :     base_class = find_base_class_of(operand_class, this_node_class);
   16417             :     if (!base_class->is_virtual) {
   16418             :       /* Not virtual.  (We cannot cast to a virtual derived class, so
   16419             :          failing this test will terminate the traversal and return NULL
   16420             :          instead of a new derived class cast node.) */
   16421             :       /* Create the bottom-most node in the chain of derived-class casts.
   16422             :          If we've reached the end of the traversal, this is also the top-most
   16423             :          node. */
   16424             :       new_derived_cast_node =
   16425             :               make_operator_node((an_expr_operator_kind)eok_derived_class_cast,
   16426             :                                  cast_dest_type,
   16427             :                                  (an_expr_node_ptr)NULL);
   16428             :       copy_node_value_category(base_cast_node, new_derived_cast_node);
   16429             :       new_derived_cast_node->variant.operation.compiler_generated = TRUE;
   16430             :       if (identical_types(operand_class, target_class)) {
   16431             :         /* We've reached the end of the traversal successfully.  The node
   16432             :            we just created is also the top of the tree. */
   16433             :         *new_top_of_tree = new_derived_cast_node;
   16434             :       } else {
   16435             :         /* We're not done with the traversal.  Call this routine recursively
   16436             :            to complete it */
   16437             :         an_expr_node_ptr new_parent =
   16438             :                  retrace_base_casts(base_cast_node->variant.operation.operands,
   16439             :                                     target_class, qualifiers_model,
   16440             :                                     new_top_of_tree);
   16441             :         if (new_parent != NULL) {
   16442             :           /* The rest of the traversal succeeded, so link the node created
   16443             :              above to the bottom of the tree of casts. */
   16444             :           new_parent->variant.operation.operands = new_derived_cast_node;
   16445             :         } else {
   16446             :           /* Discard the node we created. */
   16447             :           new_derived_cast_node = NULL;
   16448             :         }  /* if */
   16449             :       }  /* if */
   16450             :     }  /* if */
   16451             :   }  /* if */
   16452             :   return new_derived_cast_node;
   16453             : }  /* retrace_base_casts */
   16454             : 
   16455             : #endif /* OPTIMIZE_VIRTUAL_FUNCTION_CALLS */
   16456             : 
   16457           0 : a_routine_ptr final_overrider(a_routine_ptr    base_class_function,
   16458             :                               an_expr_node_ptr implicit_this_arg,
   16459             :                               a_type_ptr       complete_object_type)
   16460             : /*
   16461             : Return the final overrider of base_class_function in the class
   16462             : complete_object_type.  base_class_function is a virtual function, and
   16463             : complete_object_type is either the class of base_class_function or a
   16464             : class derived from it.  implicit_this_arg is an expression containing
   16465             : eok_base_class_cast nodes leading from complete_object_type to the
   16466             : class of base_class_function.  If the derivation is ambiguous, this
   16467             : chain of casts is used to disambiguate the derivation path.
   16468             : */
   16469             : {
   16470           0 :   a_routine_ptr target_function = base_class_function;
   16471           0 :   a_type_ptr    class_of_function = parent_class_of(base_class_function);
   16472             : 
   16473           0 :   if (!identical_types(complete_object_type, class_of_function)) {
   16474             :     /* The complete object type is a derived class, so there might be an
   16475             :        overriding function in it or an intermediate base class. */
   16476           0 :     an_overriding_virtual_function_ptr virt_func;
   16477           0 :     a_base_class_ptr                   base_class =
   16478           0 :                    find_base_class_of(complete_object_type, class_of_function);
   16479             : 
   16480           0 :     check_assertion(base_class != NULL);
   16481           0 :     if (base_class->ambiguous) {
   16482             :       /* There is more than one derivation path from the class of the
   16483             :          function to the complete object type.  There might be different
   16484             :          overriders on the various paths, some pure and some not, so we
   16485             :          can't rely on the override information in base_class (which only
   16486             :          reflects one of the paths).  We must traverse backward through
   16487             :          the implicit_this_arg base-class casts to find the correct
   16488             :          final overrider. */
   16489           0 :       an_expr_node_ptr this_node;
   16490           0 :       a_type_ptr       this_base = class_of_function;
   16491           0 :       a_boolean        pointer_case = is_pointer_type(implicit_this_arg->type);
   16492             : 
   16493           0 :       for (this_node = implicit_this_arg;
   16494           0 :            is_operation_node(this_node) &&
   16495           0 :                                !same_entities(this_base, complete_object_type);
   16496           0 :            this_node = this_node->variant.operation.operands) {
   16497           0 :         if (this_node->variant.operation.kind ==
   16498             :                                   (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_base_class_cast) {
   16499             :           /* The expression tree might have nodes other than
   16500             :              eok_base_class_cast operations (e.g., cv-qualification
   16501             :              casts, parentheses), but we can ignore those. */
   16502           0 :           a_type_ptr this_derived =this_node->variant.operation.operands->type;
   16503           0 :           if (pointer_case) this_derived = type_pointed_to(this_derived);
   16504           0 :           this_derived = skip_typerefs(this_derived);
   16505           0 :           base_class = find_base_class_of(this_derived, class_of_function);
   16506           0 :           for (virt_func = base_class->overriding_virtual_functions;
   16507           0 :                virt_func != NULL; virt_func = virt_func->next) {
   16508           0 :             if (same_entities(virt_func->primary_function, target_function)) {
   16509             :               /* Found an override. */
   16510           0 :               target_function = virt_func->overriding_function;
   16511           0 :               class_of_function = this_derived;
   16512           0 :               break;
   16513             :             }  /* if */
   16514             :           }  /* for */
   16515             :           this_base = this_derived;
   16516             :         }  /* if */
   16517             :       }  /* for */
   16518             :     } else {
   16519             :       /* The derivation is unambiguous and we can rely on the list of
   16520             :          virtual functions in base_class. */
   16521           0 :       for (virt_func = base_class->overriding_virtual_functions;
   16522           0 :            virt_func != NULL; virt_func = virt_func->next) {
   16523           0 :         if (same_entities(virt_func->primary_function, base_class_function)) {
   16524             :           /* Found an override. */
   16525           0 :           target_function = virt_func->overriding_function;
   16526           0 :           break;
   16527             :         }  /* if */
   16528             :       }  /* for */
   16529             :     }  /* if */
   16530             :   }  /* if */
   16531           0 :   return target_function;
   16532             : }  /* final_overrider */
   16533             : 
   16534             : 
   16535             : static a_boolean call_invokes_pure_virtual(a_routine_ptr    member_func,
   16536             :                                            an_expr_node_ptr function_node)
   16537             : /*
   16538             : Return TRUE iff:
   16539             : 1) we are currently in the constructor or destructor of the class of
   16540             :    member_func or one derived from it, and
   16541             : 2) the object expression of the call is either "this" or "this" modified
   16542             :    only by casts ("((B*)this)->f()"), and
   16543             : 3) member_func (or its final overrider in the class of the
   16544             :    constructor/destructor) is a pure virtual.
   16545             : 
   16546             : (Exception: MSVC++ 6.0 allowed a cast to an abstract class, which might
   16547             : result in a detectable call to a pure virtual function in other contexts,
   16548             : as well.  We check for this case, too, in microsoft_bugs mode when
   16549             : microsoft_version < 1300.)
   16550             : 
   16551             : member_func points to a virtual function, and function_node points to
   16552             : a function expression to which the argument list (including the implicit
   16553             : "this" argument) has already been appended.
   16554             : */
   16555             : {
   16556             :   a_boolean        bad_pure_virt_call = FALSE;
   16557             :   an_expr_node_ptr implicit_this_arg = function_node->next;
   16558             : 
   16559             :   if (innermost_function_scope != NULL) {
   16560             :     /* The call is in the context of a function body (as opposed to an
   16561             :        initialization in namespace scope). */
   16562             :     a_routine_ptr rp = current_routine_entry();
   16563             :     if (rp->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_constructor ||
   16564             :         rp->special_kind == (a_special_function_kind)sfk_destructor) {
   16565             :       /* We are in a constructor or destructor, but we don't know yet
   16566             :          whether it's in a class of which member_func is a member. */
   16567             :       a_type_ptr class_of_mf;
   16568             :       a_type_ptr class_of_ctor_dtor;
   16569             : 
   16570             :       class_of_mf = parent_class_of(member_func);
   16571             :       class_of_ctor_dtor = parent_class_of(rp);
   16572             :       if (is_same_class_or_base_class_thereof(class_of_ctor_dtor,
   16573             :                                               class_of_mf)) {
   16574             :         /* The class of the constructor/destructor has member_func as a
   16575             :            member.  Now check if the object expression in the call is "this"
   16576             :            or "this" cast to something ("(base*)this", "(const C*)this",
   16577             :            etc.) -- it's not an error to invoke a pure virtual from a
   16578             :            constructor/destructor if the object isn't the one under
   16579             :            construction/destruction.  The argument list, including the
   16580             :            implicit "this" argument, has already been appended to the
   16581             :            function_node, with the implicit "this" as the first successor. */
   16582             :         an_expr_node_ptr node;
   16583             : 
   16584             :         /* We scan down through any eok_cast, eok_base_class_cast, or
   16585             :            eok_derived_class_cast operators so we can compare against the
   16586             :            constructor/destructor's "this" parameter.  (Note: the eok_cast
   16587             :            case is primarily to handle qualification conversions, like
   16588             :            ((const C*)this)->f().  Casts through unrelated types, such as
   16589             :            ((C*)(unrelated*)this)->f(), are also acceptable, because they
   16590             :            don't affect whether the ultimate result would be an attempt to
   16591             :            invoke a pure virtual function.  eok_derived_class_casts are
   16592             :            added by bind_member_function_operand_to_selector to adjust the
   16593             :            type of the implicit "this" argument to an overriding virtual
   16594             :            function.) */
   16595             :         /* This scan is similar to the "call_case" processing of
   16596             :            expr_complete_object_type, except that it only applies to
   16597             :            constructors and destructors and it accepts a wider variety
   16598             :            of expression nodes -- we just have to establish the use of the
   16599             :            ctor/dtor "this" parameter and identify the final overrider, so
   16600             :            we don't need to restrict the implicit "this" argument expression
   16601             :            to one that lets us actually call the final overrider. */
   16602             :         for (node = skip_parens(implicit_this_arg);
   16603             :              is_operation_node(node) &&
   16604             :              (node_operator_is(node, eok_cast) ||
   16605             :               node_operator_is(node, eok_base_class_cast) ||
   16606             :               node_operator_is(node, eok_derived_class_cast));
   16607             :              node = skip_parens(node->variant.operation.operands)) {}
   16608             :         if (is_variable_node(node) &&
   16609             :             node_variable(node) == innermost_function_scope

   16612             :              "this" pointer.  The final check is whether the final overrider

   16647             : 
   16648             : 
   16649          62 : static a_boolean type_operator_construct_termination_next(
   16650             :                                           a_routine_ptr  rout,
   16651             :                                           a_type_ptr     function_type,
   16652             :                                           a_boolean      uses_operator_syntax)
   16653             : /*
   16654             : We are scanning the operand of a decltype construct from source (i.e., not
   16655             : rescanning the operand) and are about to generate a call to rout (with the
   16656             : given type).  If the call is the result of operator syntax,
   16657             : uses_operator_syntax is TRUE (and rout will be an operator function).  The
   16658             : caller has determined that what has been scanned so far is compatible with
   16659             : this call being the "top" operation of the decltype operand (ignoring comma
   16660             : operations).  Look ahead in the token stream to confirm that we are at the end
   16661             : of the decltype construct (which ensures that no other operation will apply on
   16662             : top of the call), and if so return TRUE; otherwise, return FALSE.
   16663             : */
   16664             : {
   16665          62 :   a_boolean      result = TRUE;  /* Assume for now. */
   16666          62 :   a_token_cache  cache;
   16667          62 :   unsigned long  n_extra_parens;
   16668             : 
   16669             :   /* Determine the number of extra parentheses around the decltype operand.
   16670             :      Subtract one for the parentheses of the type operator construct itself. */
   16671          62 :   n_extra_parens = expr_stack->nested_construct_depth-1;
   16672          62 :   clear_token_cache(&cache, /*reusable=*/FALSE);
   16673          62 :   if (uses_operator_syntax) {
   16674             :     /* Some operators ([] and postfix ++/--) may have a token left in the
   16675             :        upcoming token stream. */
   16676           0 :     a_token_kind  expected_token;
   16677           0 :     check_assertion(rout != NULL);
   16678           0 :     switch (rout->variant.opname_kind) {
   16679           0 :       case onk_subscript:
   16680           0 :         expected_token = (a_token_kind)tok_rbracket;

   16682             :            expr_stack->nested_construct_depth still includes the brackets in

   16685           0 :         break;

   16688           0 :         { a_param_type_ptr  ptp = function_type_params(function_type);

   16739             : 
   16740             : 
   16741           0 : a_boolean type_has_nodiscard_attribute(a_type_ptr type)

   16764       33005 : static an_expr_node_ptr func_call_expr(
   16765             :                                   an_expr_node_ptr  function_node,
   16766             :                                   a_type_ptr        function_type,
   16767             :                                   a_routine_ptr     rout,
   16768             :                                   a_boolean         is_virtual,
   16769             :                                   a_boolean         virtual_suppressed,
   16770             :                                   a_boolean         selector_is_object_pointer,
   16771             :                                   a_boolean         compiler_generated,
   16772             :                                   a_boolean         is_conversion,
   16773             :                                   a_boolean         arg_dep_lookup_suppressed,
   16774             :                                   a_boolean         qualified_function_name,
   16775             :                                   a_boolean         found_through_adl,
   16776             :                                   a_boolean         uses_operator_syntax,
   16777             :                                   a_source_position *pos,
   16778             :                                   an_expr_node_ptr  *function_call_node)
   16779             : /*
   16780             : Make an expression for a call of the function indicated by function_node,
   16781             : whose type is function_type, and which is to be called virtually if is_virtual
   16782             : is TRUE, or a pointer-to-member-function call if the type of function_node is
   16783             : pointer-to-member-function.  rout is the called function if it is known, or
   16784             : NULL otherwise.  The arguments of the call are already attached to
   16785             : function_node.  A skip_typerefs need not have been done on function_type.
   16786             : function_type can be a template parameter type or class type in a case where
   16787             : the function to be called is not known because the call is dependent.
   16788             : Return a pointer to the call node.  *pos gives the call position.  When the
   16789             : function return type is invalid (i.e., incomplete) an error node is returned.
   16790             : If virtual_suppressed is TRUE, the function was named in some way that
   16791             : would suppress calling it as virtual (if indeed it is virtual); that's
   16792             : also reflected in is_virtual, but knowing that the user did it
   16793             : explicitly controls whether a diagnostic is put out in some cases.
   16794             : selector_is_object_pointer is TRUE if the call is a nonstatic member
   16795             : function call and the source form was "->" (or "->*" for the
   16796             : pointer-to-member case) rather than "." (or ".*").  compiler_generated
   16797             : is TRUE if this call is compiler-generated (e.g., for an implicit
   16798             : conversion via a conversion function).  is_conversion is TRUE for a
   16799             : call generated for an explicit or implicit conversion (e.g., a
   16800             : conversion function call).  arg_dep_lookup_suppressed is TRUE if
   16801             : argument-dependent lookup was suppressed on the call because the
   16802             : function name is not followed by a left parenthesis.
   16803             : qualified_function_name is TRUE if argument-dependent lookup was
   16804             : suppressed because the function name is qualified.  found_through_adl
   16805             : is TRUE if the call was resolved only through argument-dependent
   16806             : lookup (i.e., ordinary lookup did not yield the called function).
   16807             : uses_operator_syntax is TRUE when a call to an overloaded operator is
   16808             : the result of operator notation ("a+b") rather than an explicit
   16809             : function call.  If non-NULL, function_call_node is the address of an
   16810             : expression node pointer that will be set to point to the actual call
   16811             : node itself (which might be below the node returned because of
   16812             : transformations on the return value).  It is returned NULL for some
   16813             : error cases.
   16814             : */
   16815             : {
   16816       33005 :   an_expr_operator_kind         op;

   17011       33005 : void make_function_call(an_expr_node_ptr  function_node,
   17012             :                         a_type_ptr        function_type,
   17013             :                         a_boolean         is_virtual,
   17014             :                         a_boolean         virtual_suppressed,
   17015             :                         a_boolean         selector_is_object_pointer,
   17016             :                         a_boolean         compiler_generated,
   17017             :                         a_boolean         is_conversion,
   17018             :                         a_boolean         arg_dep_lookup_suppressed,
   17019             :                         a_boolean         qualified_function_name,
   17020             :                         a_boolean         found_through_adl,
   17021             :                         a_boolean         uses_operator_syntax,
   17022             :                         a_source_position *call_pos,
   17023             :                         an_operand        *result,
   17024             :                         a_boolean         *p_folded,
   17025             :                         an_expr_node_ptr  *p_function_call_node)
   17026             : /*
   17027             : Make an operand for a call of the function indicated by function_node,
   17028             : whose type is function_type, and which is to be called virtually if
   17029             : is_virtual is TRUE, or a pointer-to-member-function call if the type
   17030             : of function_node is pointer-to-member-function.  The arguments of the
   17031             : call are already attached to function_node.  A skip_typerefs need not
   17032             : have been done on function_type.  function_type can be a template
   17033             : parameter type or class type in a case where the function to be called
   17034             : is not known because the call is dependent.  If virtual_suppressed is
   17035             : TRUE, the function was named in some way that would suppress calling
   17036             : it as virtual (if indeed it is virtual); that's also reflected in
   17037             : is_virtual, but knowing that the user did it explicitly controls
   17038             : whether a diagnostic is put out in some cases.
   17039             : selector_is_object_pointer is TRUE if the call is a nonstatic member
   17040             : function call and the source form was "->" (or "->*" for the
   17041             : pointer-to-member case) rather than "." (or ".*").  compiler_generated
   17042             : is TRUE if this is a compiler-generated call (e.g., for an implicit
   17043             : conversion via a conversion function).  is_conversion is TRUE for a
   17044             : call generated for an explicit or implicit conversion (e.g., a
   17045             : conversion function call).  arg_dep_lookup_suppressed is TRUE if
   17046             : argument-dependent lookup was suppressed on the call because the
   17047             : function name was not followed by a left parenthesis.
   17048             : qualified_function_name is TRUE if argument-dependent lookup was
   17049             : suppressed because the function name was qualified.  found_through_adl
   17050             : is TRUE if the call was resolved only through argument-dependent
   17051             : lookup (i.e., ordinary lookup did not yield the called function).
   17052             : uses_operator_syntax is TRUE when a call to an overloaded operator is
   17053             : the result of operator notation ("a+b") rather than an explicit
   17054             : function call.  *call_pos gives the source position of the call.  If
   17055             : non-NULL, p_function_call_node is the address of an expression node
   17056             : pointer that will be set to point to the actual call node itself
   17057             : (which might be below the expression in the result because of
   17058             : transformations on the return value).  It is returned NULL for some
   17059             : error cases.  If p_folded is non-NULL, *p_folded is set to reflect
   17060             : whether the call was folded or not.
   17061             : */
   17062             : {
   17063       33005 :   an_expr_node_ptr call_node;
   17064       33005 :   a_routine_ptr    rout = routine_from_function_expr(function_node);
   17065       33005 :   a_boolean        folded = FALSE;
   17066             : 
   17067             : #if GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED

   17198       32965 : void assemble_function_call(an_operand        *function_operand,
   17199             :                             an_operand        *bound_function_selector,
   17200             :                             an_expr_node_ptr  argument_list,
   17201             :                             a_boolean         compiler_generated,
   17202             :                             a_boolean         arg_dep_lookup_suppressed,
   17203             :                             a_boolean         qualified_function_name,
   17204             :                             a_boolean         found_through_adl,
   17205             :                             a_boolean         uses_operator_syntax,
   17206             :                             a_source_position *call_position,
   17207             :                             an_operand        *result,
   17208             :                             a_boolean         *p_folded,
   17209             :                             an_expr_node_ptr  *function_call_node)
   17210             : /*
   17211             : Assemble a function call from the various pieces.  *function_operand
   17212             : identifies the function to be called.  It can identify an unknown
   17213             : dependent function if the call is dependent.  If a selector object is
   17214             : needed, it is provided by *bound_function_selector.  argument_list
   17215             : points to the (explicit) argument list.  compiler_generated is TRUE if
   17216             : this is a compiler- generated call (e.g., to an overloaded operator
   17217             : function).  The call is not of a conversion function.
   17218             : arg_dep_lookup_suppressed is TRUE if argument-dependent lookup was
   17219             : suppressed on the call because the function name was not followed by a
   17220             : left parenthesis.  qualified_function_name is TRUE if
   17221             : argument-dependent lookup was suppressed because the function name was
   17222             : qualified.  found_through_adl is TRUE if the function to be called was
   17223             : only found through argument-dependent lookup (not through ordinary
   17224             : lookup).  uses_operator_syntax is TRUE when a call to an overloaded
   17225             : operator is the result of operator notation ("a+b") rather than an
   17226             : explicit function call.  call_position gives the source position of
   17227             : the call.  An operand for the overall call is constructed in *result.
   17228             : If non-NULL, function_call_node is the address of an expression node
   17229             : pointer that will be set to point to the actual call node itself
   17230             : (which might be below the expression in the result because of
   17231             : transformations on the return value).  It is returned NULL for some
   17232             : error cases.  If p_folded is non-NULL, *p_folded is set to reflect
   17233             : whether the call was folded or not.
   17234             : */
   17235             : {
   17236       32965 :   an_expr_node_ptr function_node;

   17364           0 : a_statement_ptr make_call_assignment_statement(
   17365             :                                             a_routine_ptr     rout,

   17369             :                                             a_source_position *err_pos)
   17370             : /*
   17371             : Create an expression statement pointing to a call operator that calls
   17372             : the operator= function "rout" to assign the lvalue "source" to the object

   17428             :                         err_pos,
   17429             :                         /*function_call_node=*/(an_expr_node_ptr *)NULL);
   17430           0 :   if (is_any_reference_type(node->type)) {
   17431             :     /* The function returns a reference. */

   17436           0 :   stmt = alloc_expr_statement(node);

   17441             : 
   17442             : 
   17443       41556 : void using_lvalue(an_operand *operand)
   17444             : /*
   17445             : Called when an lvalue is going to be used: the left side of assignment
   17446             : operators, the operand of increment/decrement operators, the left
   17447             : operand of the "." operator, and when an lvalue is converted to an
   17448             : rvalue.  This routine checks that the address indicated by the lvalue
   17449             : is valid; specifically, it checks for actually using the element just
   17450             : past the end of an array.  It's okay to take the address of that
   17451             : element, but it's not okay to actually reference it.  "operand"
   17452             : can also be an xvalue.

   17459             :        the end of an array. */

   17470        6004 : static void examine_expr_for_bit_field_selection(

   17492        5374 : static a_boolean is_bit_field_expr(an_expr_node_ptr node)

   17500             :      A prvalue bit field selection is just a value of integral type. */

   17531           0 : a_boolean is_bit_field_whose_address_can_be_taken(a_field_ptr field)
   17532             : /*
   17533             : Return TRUE if the indicated field (a bit field) is one whose address
   17534             : can be taken (as an extension).
   17535             : */

   17537           0 :   a_boolean        addr_can_be_taken = FALSE;
   17538           0 :   a_targ_size_t    field_size, type_size;
   17539           0 :   a_targ_alignment type_alignment, struct_alignment;
   17540           0 :   an_integer_kind  int_kind;

   17542             :   /* In strict ANSI mode, don't allow this. */

   17558             :           /* The signedness must match. */

   17579           0 : static a_boolean is_bit_field_operand_whose_address_can_be_taken(

   17609        3677 : static a_boolean check_for_taking_the_address_of_a_bit_field(
