   17632             : 
   17633             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   17634             : 
   17635             : static a_boolean r_is_this_parameter_expr(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   17636             : /*
   17637             : Helper routine for is_this_parameter_expr_in_current_scope to handle the
   17638             : recursive walk of the expression tree.  Traverse the expression and return
   17639             : TRUE if it is equivalent to "this" or "*this".  The innermost function scope is
   17640             : assumed to be a member function, and the expression is assumed to have the
   17641             : same type as "this" or "*this".  The captured "this" of a lambda is not
   17642             : considered to match.
   17643             : */
   17644             : {
   17645             :   a_boolean result = FALSE;
   17646             : 
   17647             :   if (is_variable_node(expr)) {
   17648             :     a_variable_ptr this_var;
   17649             :     check_assertion(innermost_function_scope != NULL);
   17650             :     this_var = innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.this_param_variable;
   17651             :     check_assertion(this_var != NULL);
   17652             :     result = (node_variable(expr) == this_var);
   17653             :   } else if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
   17654             :     an_expr_operator_kind op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   17655             :     an_expr_node_ptr      operand1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   17656             :     an_expr_node_ptr      operand2 = operand1->next;
   17657             :     switch (op) {
   17658             :       case eok_parens:
   17659             :         /* (x): Okay if x is "this" or "*this". */
   17660             :         result = r_is_this_parameter_expr(operand1);
   17661             :         break;
   17662             :       case eok_indirect:
   17663             :         /* *x: Okay if x is "this". */
   17664             :         result = r_is_this_parameter_expr(operand1);
   17665             :         break;
   17666             :       case eok_address_of:
   17667             :         /* &x: Okay if x is "*this". */
   17668             :         result = r_is_this_parameter_expr(operand1);
   17669             :         break;
   17670             :       case eok_comma:
   17671             :         /* (x, y): Okay if y is "this" or "*this". */
   17672             :         result = r_is_this_parameter_expr(operand2);
   17673             :         break;
   17674             :       case eok_question:
   17675             :         /* (x ? y : z): Okay if both y and z are "this" or "*this". */
   17676             :         result = r_is_this_parameter_expr(operand2) &&
   17677             :                  r_is_this_parameter_expr(operand2->next);
   17678             :         break;
   17679             :       default:
   17680             :         /* An operation was encountered that results in the expression not
   17681             :            being equivalent to "this" or "*this". */
   17682             :         result = FALSE;
   17683             :         break;
   17684             :     }  /* switch */
   17685             :   } else if (expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_object_lifetime) {
   17686             :     /* An object lifetime passes the expression through. */
   17687             :     result = r_is_this_parameter_expr(expr->variant.object_lifetime.expr);
   17688             :   } else {
   17689             :     /* This expression precludes it from being equivalent to "this" or
   17690             :        "*this". */
   17691             :     result = FALSE;
   17692             :   }  /* if */
   17693             :   return result;
   17694             : }  /* r_is_this_parameter_expr */
   17695             : 
   17696             : 
   17697             : static a_boolean is_this_parameter_expr_in_current_scope(
   17698             :                                                         an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   17699             : /*
   17700             : Return TRUE if the expression is equivalent to "this" or "*this".  Return
   17701             : FALSE if the innermost function scope is not a non-static member function.
   17702             : The captured "this" of a lambda is not considered to match.  This is used to
   17703             : determine if a field selection operator selects a field in the same class
   17704             : instance on which the non-static member function was called.  "expr" will be
   17705             : the first operand of an eok_dot_field or eok_points_to_field operator, and
   17706             : will therefore be of class type, pointer to class type, C++/CLI handle to ref
   17707             : class type, or C++/CLI interior_ptr<T> type.
   17708             : */
   17709             : {
   17710             :   a_boolean is_this_parameter_expr = FALSE;
   17711             : 
   17712             :   if (innermost_function_scope != NULL &&
   17713             :       innermost_function_scope->variant.routine.this_param_variable != NULL) {
   17714             :     a_variable_ptr this_var = innermost_function_scope->
   17715             :                                           variant.routine.this_param_variable;
   17716             :     a_type_ptr     this_class_type = type_pointed_to(this_var->type);
   17717             :     a_type_ptr     expr_class_type = is_pointer_or_handle_type(expr->type)
   17718             :                                                  ? type_pointed_to(expr->type)
   17719             :                                                  : expr->type;
   17720             :     if (identical_types_ignoring_qualifiers(this_class_type,
   17721             :                                             expr_class_type)) {
   17722             :       /* The expression has the same type as "this" or "*this", so traverse
   17723             :          the expression to see whether it is in fact equivalent to "this" or
   17724             :          "*this". */
   17725             :       is_this_parameter_expr = r_is_this_parameter_expr(expr);
   17726             :     }  /* if */
   17727             :   }  /* if */
   17728             :   return is_this_parameter_expr;
   17729             : }  /* is_this_parameter_expr_in_current_scope */
   17730             : 
   17731             : 
   17732             : static void examine_expr_for_initonly_field_selection(
   17733             :                                    an_expr_node_ptr                    expr,
   17734             :                                    an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   17735             : /*
   17736             : Called from the expression traversal routines to process an expression
   17737             : as part of seeing whether an expression is a C++/CLI initonly field selection.
   17738             : */
   17739             : {
   17740             :   an_expr_node_ptr initonly_field_node = NULL;
   17741             :   an_expr_node_ptr class_instance_node = NULL;
   17742             : 
   17743             :   if (!is_glvalue_node(expr)) {
   17744             :     /* An initonly field selection is a glvalue. */
   17745             :     tblock->suppress_subtree_walk = TRUE;
   17746             :   } else if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
   17747             :     if (node_operator_is(expr, eok_indirect) ||
   17748             :         node_operator_is(expr, eok_ref_indirect) ||
   17749             :         node_operator_is(expr, eok_subscript) ||
   17750             :         node_operator_is(expr, eok_cli_subscript)) {
   17751             :       /* These operations do not result in an initonly field selection. */
   17752             :       tblock->suppress_subtree_walk = TRUE;
   17753             :     } else if (node_operator_is(expr, eok_dot_field) ||
   17754             :                node_operator_is(expr, eok_points_to_field)) {
   17755             :       if (node_field(expr->variant.operation.operands->next)->is_initonly) {
   17756             :         /* A reference to a nonstatic initonly field. */
   17757             :         class_instance_node = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   17758             :         initonly_field_node = expr->variant.operation.operands->next;
   17759             :       }  /* if */
   17760             :       if (node_operator_is(expr, eok_points_to_field)) {
   17761             :         /* There is no need to inspect the left-hand operand, as it has no
   17762             :            bearing on the expression being an initonly field selection.
   17763             :            We still must inspect the left-hand operand in the eok_dot_field
   17764             :            case to handle cases such as (b ? x : y).z where z is not itself an
   17765             :            initonly field selection, but either x or y is. */
   17766             :         tblock->suppress_subtree_walk = TRUE;
   17767             :       }  /* if */
   17768             :     } else if (node_operator_is(expr, eok_dot_static) ||
   17769             :                node_operator_is(expr, eok_points_to_static)) {
   17770             :       if (is_variable_node(expr->variant.operation.operands->next) &&
   17771             :           node_variable(expr->variant.operation.operands->next)->is_initonly) {
   17772             :         /* A reference to a static initonly field of the form x.y or p->y. */
   17773             :         initonly_field_node = expr->variant.operation.operands->next;
   17774             :       }  /* if */
   17775             :       /* The left-hand operand has no bearing on this expression being an
   17776             :          initonly field selection. */
   17777             :       tblock->suppress_subtree_walk = TRUE;
   17778             :     }  /* if */
   17779             :   } else if (is_variable_node(expr) && node_variable(expr)->is_initonly) {
   17780             :     /* A direct reference to a static initonly field. */
   17781             :     initonly_field_node = expr;
   17782             :   }  /* if */
   17783             :   if (initonly_field_node != NULL) {
   17784             :     a_boolean skip_node = FALSE;
   17785             :     if (tblock->skip_valid_lvalue_uses_of_initonly_fields &&
   17786             :         innermost_function_scope != NULL) {
   17787             :       /* Skip any initonly field selections that are valid lvalue uses within
   17788             :          the innermost function scope. */
   17789             :       a_routine_ptr routine = current_routine_entry();
   17790             :       if (special_kind_is(routine, sfk_constructor)) {
   17791             :         if (is_field_node(initonly_field_node) &&
   17792             :             is_this_parameter_expr_in_current_scope(class_instance_node)) {
   17793             :           /* The expression is a nonstatic initonly field selection being
   17794             :              evaluated within the context of its parent class' instance
   17795             :              constructor.  This is a valid lvalue use of the field. */
   17796             :           skip_node = TRUE;
   17797             :         }  /* if */
   17798             :       } else if (special_kind_is(routine, sfk_static_constructor)) {
   17799             :         if (is_variable_node(initonly_field_node) &&
   17800             :             same_entities(
   17801             :                        parent_class_of(routine),
   17802             :                        parent_class_of(node_variable(initonly_field_node)))) {
   17803             :           /* The expression is a static initonly field selection being
   17804             :              evaluated within the context of its parent class' static
   17805             :              constructor.  This is a valid lvalue use of the field. */
   17806             :           skip_node = TRUE;
   17807             :         }  /* if */
   17808             :       }  /* if */
   17809             :     }  /* if */
   17810             :     if (!skip_node) {
   17811             :       /* This expression is a C++/CLI initonly field selection. */
   17812             :       tblock->is_static_initonly_field = 
   17813             :                                         is_variable_node(initonly_field_node);
   17814             :       tblock->result = TRUE;
   17815             :       tblock->terminate = TRUE;
   17816             :     }  /* if */
   17817             :   }  /* if */
   17818             : }  /* examine_expr_for_initonly_field_selection */
   17819             : 
   17820             : 
   17821             : static a_boolean is_initonly_field_operand(
   17822             :                                        an_operand *operand,
   17823             :                                        a_boolean  skip_valid_lvalue_uses,
   17824             :                                        a_boolean  *p_is_static_initonly_field)
   17825             : /*
   17826             : If skip_valid_lvalue_uses is FALSE, return TRUE if the operand is a C++/CLI
   17827             : initonly field reference.  If skip_valid_lvalue_uses is TRUE, return TRUE
   17828             : only if the operand is a C++/CLI initonly field reference that should be
   17829             : treated as unmodifiable due to its use occurring outside of the constructor
   17830             : context in which it is allowed to be modified.  If p_is_static_initonly_field
   17831             : is non-NULL, set *p_is_static_initonly_field to TRUE if the field found
   17832             : is a static initonly member.
   17833             : */
   17834             : {
   17835             :   a_boolean is_initonly_field = FALSE;
   17836             : 
   17837             :   check_assertion(cli_or_cx_enabled);
   17838             :   if (is_an_lvalue(operand) && is_expression_operand(operand)) {
   17839             :     /* Walk the expression's addressing parts to see whether this is a C++/CLI
   17840             :        initonly field selection either at the top level or deeper down. */
   17841             :     an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block tblock;
   17842             :     clear_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block(&tblock);
   17843             :     tblock.process_expr = examine_expr_for_initonly_field_selection;
   17844             :     tblock.follow_addressing_path = TRUE;
   17845             :     tblock.skip_valid_lvalue_uses_of_initonly_fields = skip_valid_lvalue_uses;
   17846             :     traverse_expr(operand->variant.expression, &tblock);
   17847             :     is_initonly_field = tblock.result;
   17848             :     if (is_initonly_field && p_is_static_initonly_field != NULL) {
   17849             :       *p_is_static_initonly_field = tblock.is_static_initonly_field;
   17850             :     }  /* if */
   17851             :   }  /* if */
   17852             :   return is_initonly_field;
   17853             : }  /* is_initonly_field_operand */
   17854             : 
   17855             : 
   17856             : a_boolean is_any_initonly_field_operand(an_operand *operand)
   17857             : /*
   17858             : Return TRUE if the operand is a C++/CLI initonly field reference.
   17859             : */
   17860             : {

   18244         394 : void take_address_of_lvalue(an_operand        *operand,
   18245             :                             a_source_position *operator_position)
   18246             : /*
   18247             : Change operand (an lvalue) to a prvalue that is a pointer to the
   18248             : object.  This is the function of the "&" operator.  Check that the
   18249             : operand isn't a register variable or a bit field, and set the
   18250             : address_taken flag.  Also works on function designators.

   18252             : in the source and *operator_position gives its position.
   18253             : */
   18254             : {
   18255         394 :   take_address_of_or_reference_to_lvalue(operand,
   18256             :                                          /*reference_case=*/FALSE,
   18257             :                                          /*rvalue_reference_case=*/FALSE,

   18261         394 : }  /* take_address_of_lvalue */
   18262             : 
   18263             : 
   18264        3299 : void take_reference_to_operand(an_operand *operand,
   18265             :                                a_boolean  rvalue_reference_case)
   18266             : /*
   18267             : Change operand (a glvalue or class prvalue) to a prvalue that is a reference
   18268             : to the object.  This is the value that is stored in a reference bound to the
   18269             : object.  Check that the operand isn't a register variable or a bit
   18270             : field, and set the address_taken flag.  Also works on function
   18271             : designators.  rvalue_reference_case is TRUE if the reference being bound
   18272             : is an rvalue reference.
   18273             : */
   18274             : {
   18275        3299 :   if (is_error_operand(operand)) {
   18276           0 :     normalize_error_operand(operand);

   18280             :                                            /*reference_case=*/TRUE,
   18281             :                                            rvalue_reference_case,
   18282             :                                            /*use_handle_for_ref_class=*/FALSE,
   18283             :                                            /*is_builtin_addressof=*/FALSE,
   18284             :                                            (a_source_position *)NULL);
   18285             :   } else {
   18286             :     /* Binding a reference to a class prvalue. */
   18287         191 :     an_expr_node_ptr expr = NULL;
   18288         191 :     an_operand       orig_operand;
   18289         191 :     check_assertion(is_an_rvalue(operand) &&
   18290             :                     (is_class_struct_union_type(operand->type) ||

   18328             : 
   18329             : 
   18330        4703 : void modifying_lvalue(an_operand *operand,
   18331             :                       a_boolean  value_used)

   18351             : 
   18352           0 : void conv_object_pointer_to_lvalue(an_operand *operand)
   18353             : /*

   18370             : 
   18371             : 
   18372           0 : static a_boolean okay_as_gcc_lvalue_question(an_expr_node_ptr op2,
   18373             :                                              an_expr_node_ptr op3,
   18374             :                                              a_boolean        ignore_casts,
   18375             :                                              a_type_ptr       *lvalue_type)
   18376             : /*
   18377             : Return TRUE if a prvalue expression that is a "?" operator with the
   18378             : indicated two expressions as the second and third operands can be
   18379             : converted to an lvalue "?" in gcc (not g++) mode.  If ignore_casts is TRUE,
   18380             : ignore any casts on top of the expressions.  *lvalue_type is set to the
   18381             : result type for the lvalue operation.
   18382             : */
   18383             : {
   18384           0 :   a_boolean  okay = FALSE;
   18385           0 :   a_type_ptr res_type = NULL, type2, type3;
   18386           0 :   a_boolean  op2_possible, op3_possible;
   18387             : 
   18388             :   /* Note that by the time a "?" operation gets here, it has
   18389             :      been validated as a correct prvalue operation, so a certain
   18390             :      level of compatibility between the operands has already been
   18391             :      established. */
   18392             :   /* Do a test conversion of the expressions to lvalues, to
   18393             :      see whether they can be converted to lvalues and to find out what
   18394             :      their lvalue types are.  The lvalue types may have cv-qualifiers
   18395             :      that the prvalue versions don't. */
   18396           0 :   (void)conv_prvalue_expr_to_lvalue(op2, &op2_possible,
   18397             :                                     /*see_if_possible=*/TRUE,
   18398             :                                     /*gcc_lvalue=*/TRUE,
   18399             :                                     ignore_casts, &type2);
   18400           0 :   (void)conv_prvalue_expr_to_lvalue(op3, &op3_possible,
   18401             :                                     /*see_if_possible=*/TRUE,
   18402             :                                     /*gcc_lvalue=*/TRUE,
   18403             :                                     ignore_casts, &type3);
   18404           0 :   if (!op2_possible || !op3_possible) {
   18405             :     /* One or both of the operands cannot be converted to an lvalue,
   18406             :        so give up. */
   18407           0 :   } else if (is_class_struct_union_type(type2)) {
   18408             :     /* For struct types, only the exact same type will work. */
   18409           0 :     okay = identical_types(type2, type3);
   18410           0 :     res_type = type2;
   18411           0 :   } else if (!is_scalar_type(type2) ||
   18412           0 :              !is_scalar_type(type3)) {
   18413             :     /* Rule out void and function types. */
   18414             :     /* okay = FALSE; -- already set. */
   18415           0 :   } else if (identical_types(type2, type3)) {
   18416             :     /* The types match. */
   18417           0 :     okay = TRUE;
   18418           0 :     res_type = type2;
   18419           0 :   } else if (get_type_qualifiers(type2) == get_type_qualifiers(type3) &&
   18420           0 :              still_an_lvalue(type2, type3)) {
   18421             :     /* The types match enough that an lvalue cast can bridge the gap.
   18422             :        We also require that the cv-qualifiers match, to avoid problems
   18423             :        with cases like
   18424             :          int i;
   18425             :          const int j;
   18426             :          (i ? i : j) = 1;  // Modifiable or not?
   18427             :     */
   18428           0 :     okay = TRUE;
   18429             :     /* Favor an integral type as the result type. */
   18430           0 :     if (is_integral_type(type2)) {
   18431           0 :       res_type = type2;
   18432           0 :     } else if (is_integral_type(type3)) {
   18433           0 :       res_type = type3;
   18434             :     } else {
   18435           0 :       res_type = type2;
   18436             :     }  /* if */
   18437             :   }  /* if */
   18438           0 :   if (okay) {
   18439           0 :     *lvalue_type = res_type;
   18440             :   }  /* if */
   18441           0 :   return okay;
   18442             : }  /* okay_as_gcc_lvalue_question */
   18443             : 
   18444             : 
   18445           8 : static an_expr_node_ptr conv_prvalue_expr_to_lvalue(
   18446             :                                               an_expr_node_ptr node,
   18447             :                                               a_boolean        *converted,
   18448             :                                               a_boolean        see_if_possible,
   18449             :                                               a_boolean        gcc_lvalue,
   18450             :                                               a_boolean        ignore_casts,
   18451             :                                               a_type_ptr       *p_lvalue_type)
   18452             : /*
   18453             : node is a prvalue expression.  If possible, rewrite it as an lvalue
   18454             : for the object, and return a pointer to the lvalue expression along
   18455             : with *converted TRUE.  If such a conversion is not possible, set
   18456             : *converted FALSE and return the unmodified original expression.  If
   18457             : see_if_possible is TRUE, just see if the rewriting is possible,
   18458             : set *converted accordingly, and return the unmodified expression.  If
   18459             : gcc_lvalue is TRUE, we're rewriting the operand in a case where gcc
   18460             : (not g++) allows treating an rvalue as an lvalue.  If ignore_casts is
   18461             : TRUE, ignore any casts on top of the expression (throw them away, then
   18462             : turn the expression into an lvalue; this will affect the returned
   18463             : expression pointer even if no transformation is done).  If
   18464             : p_lvalue_type is non-NULL, *p_lvalue_type is set to the type of the
   18465             : lvalue; it might differ from the original node type in having extra
   18466             : cv-qualifiers.  It is set even when see_if_possible is TRUE (in fact,
   18467             : that's the usual use case).  This routine undoes glvalue-to-prvalue
   18468             : conversions (which is always possible) and also tracks class prvalues
   18469             : back to the call that generated them, and rewrites the call to produce
   18470             : an lvalue (which is usually but not always possible).  This routine is
   18471             : used for reference casts that allow a source expression that is an
   18472             : prvalue, and for certain extensions, such as the GNU and Microsoft bugs
   18473             : that allow some prvalues to be used as if they were lvalues.
   18474             : It is also used in IL lowering, via conv_prvalue_expr_to_object_pointer.
   18475             : As will be clear from that, this routine can be called from outside
   18476             : of the expression routines; it does not reference things like the
   18477             : expr_stack.  However, it can't be called from outside the front end,
   18478             : e.g., in a back end.  Note that when this routine is called on a
   18479             : lowered expression, the resulting lvalue will have the same type as
   18480             : the prvalue type (this is necessary to prevent const-qualification
   18481             : from being re-introduced once lowering has eliminated it).
   18482             : */
   18483             : {
   18484           8 :   a_boolean        possible = FALSE;
   18485           8 :   a_type_ptr       lvalue_type;
   18486             : 
   18487           8 :   if (ignore_casts) {
   18488           0 :     node = remove_cast_operations(node);
   18489             :   }  /* if */
   18490           8 :   check_assertion(!is_glvalue_node(node));
   18491           8 :   check_assertion(in_front_end);
   18492           8 :   lvalue_type = node->type;
   18493           8 :   if (node->orig_lvalue_type != NULL) {
   18494             :     /* If the lvalue type was saved on the conversion from lvalue to rvalue,
   18495             :        use that type. */
   18496           0 :     lvalue_type = node->orig_lvalue_type;
   18497             :   }  /* if */
   18498             :   /* No skip_parens here.  Parentheses are handled under the enk_operation
   18499             :      case. */
   18500           8 :   if (is_variable_node(node)) {
   18501             :     /* The value of a variable.  Change it to an lvalue for the variable. */
   18502           0 :     a_variable_ptr var = node_variable(node);
   18503           0 :     possible = TRUE;
   18504             :     /* Re-fetch the variable type, because cv-qualifiers might have been
   18505             :        dropped in converting it to an rvalue. */
   18506           0 :     lvalue_type = var->type;
   18507           0 :     check_assertion(!is_any_reference_type(lvalue_type));
   18508             : #if DO_IL_LOWERING
   18509             :     if (il_lowering_underway &&
   18510             :         var->is_parameter && var->variant.assoc_param_type != NULL &&
   18511             :         var->variant.assoc_param_type->passed_via_copy_constructor &&
   18512             :         is_pointer_type(lvalue_type) && !is_pointer_type(node->type)) {
   18513             :       /* IL lowering rewrites the types of variables that are parameters
   18514             :          passed by copy constructor, to add a "pointer-to" to the type.
   18515             :          If the variable type has been changed already, but the
   18516             :          node we're working on hasn't been lowered yet, use the
   18517             :          class type, not the pointer type, for the lvalue type. */
   18518             :       lvalue_type = type_pointed_to(lvalue_type);
   18519             :       check_assertion(identical_types_ignoring_qualifiers(lvalue_type,
   18520             :                                                           node->type));
   18521             :     }  /* if */
   18522             : #endif /* DO_IL_LOWERING */
   18523           8 :   } else if (node->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_param_ref) {
   18524             :     /* A reference to a parameter.  Change it to an lvalue by just changing
   18525             :        the is_lvalue flag.  But a reference to "this" can't be turned into
   18526             :        an lvalue. */
   18527           0 :     if (node->variant.param_ref.param_num != 0) {
   18528           0 :       possible = TRUE;
   18529             :     }  /* if */
   18530           8 :   } else if (node->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_temp_init) {
   18531             :     /* A temporary initialization indicating the value of a temporary.
   18532             :        Change it to an lvalue for the temporary. */
   18533           8 :     possible = TRUE;
   18534           0 :   } else if (is_constant_node(node)) {
   18535           0 :     a_constant_ptr  con = node_constant(node);
   18536           0 :     if (con->is_result_of_constexpr_call && con->expr != NULL &&

   18538             :       /* We sometimes fold rvalue enk_temp_init nodes before knowing that they
   18539             :          will be turned back into lvalues. */
   18540           0 :       possible = TRUE;
   18541           0 :       if (!see_if_possible) {
   18542           0 :         node = con->expr;
   18543             :       }  /* if */
   18544             :     }  /* if */
   18545           0 :   } else if (node->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_lambda) {
   18546             :     /* A lambda.  Change it to an lvalue by just changing the is_lvalue
   18547             :        flag. */
   18548           0 :     possible = TRUE;
   18549           0 :   } else if (node->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_typeid) {
   18550             :     /* An rvalue for a typeid can be turned back into an lvalue. */
   18551           0 :     possible = TRUE;
   18552           0 :     lvalue_type = make_qualified_type(lvalue_type,
   18553             :                                       (a_type_qualifier_set)TQ_CONST);
   18554           0 :   } else if (node->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_object_lifetime) {

   18556             :        enk_object_lifetime has been added. */
   18557           0 :     unexpected_condition();
   18558           0 :   } else if (is_operation_node(node)) {
   18559             :     /* An operator node. */
   18560           0 :     an_expr_operator_kind op = node->variant.operation.kind;
   18561           0 :     an_expr_node_ptr      op1 = node->variant.operation.operands;
   18562           0 :     an_expr_node_ptr      op2 = op1->next;
   18563           0 :     an_expr_node_ptr      op3 = NULL;
   18564           0 :     a_boolean             op1_possible, op2_possible, op3_possible;
   18565             :     /* Note that skip_parens is not called on the operands at this
   18566             :        point, because we still want to be able to unlink/relink the original
   18567             :        operands. */
   18568           0 :     switch (op) {
   18569           0 :       case eok_indirect:
   18570             :       case eok_ref_indirect:
   18571             :         /* The top operator is an indirection, so we can just change the node
   18572             :            to an lvalue. */
   18573           0 :         possible = TRUE;
   18574           0 :         if (is_ptr_or_ref_type(op1->type)) {
   18575           0 :           lvalue_type = type_pointed_to(op1->type);
   18576             :         }  /* if */
   18577             :         break;
   18578           0 :       case eok_subscript:
   18579             :         /* "[]" operator -- transform to an lvalue. */
   18580           0 :         possible = TRUE;
   18581             :         /* Get the lvalue type from the pointer operand, which can be either
   18582             :            one. */
   18583           0 :         if (is_pointer_type(op1->type)) {
   18584           0 :           lvalue_type = type_pointed_to(op1->type);
   18585           0 :         } else if (is_pointer_type(op2->type)) {
   18586           0 :           lvalue_type = type_pointed_to(op2->type);
   18587             :         }  /* if */
   18588             :         break;
   18589             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   18590             :       case eok_cli_subscript:
   18591             :         /* C++/CLI subscript operator -- transform to an lvalue. */
   18592             :         possible = TRUE;
   18593             :         if (is_handle_type(op1->type)) {
   18594             :           a_type_ptr arr_type = type_pointed_to(op1->type);

   18596             :             lvalue_type = cli_array_element_type(arr_type);
   18597             :           }  /* if */
   18598             :         }  /* if */
   18599             :         break;
   18600             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   18601           0 :       case eok_parens:
   18602             :         /* Parentheses: just do a recursive call on the operand. */
   18603           0 :         op1 = conv_prvalue_expr_to_lvalue(op1, &possible,
   18604             :                                           see_if_possible,
   18605             :                                           gcc_lvalue,
   18606             :                                           ignore_casts,
   18607             :                                           &lvalue_type);
   18608           0 :         if (possible && !see_if_possible) {
   18609           0 :           node->variant.operation.operands = op1;
   18610             :         }  /* if */
   18611             :         break;
   18612           0 :       case eok_question:
   18613           0 :         { a_boolean  op2_is_throw = FALSE, op3_is_throw = FALSE;
   18614             :           /* "?" operator -- transform each branch independently to an
   18615             :              lvalue. */
   18616           0 :           op3 = op2->next;
   18617           0 :           if (C_mode() && !gcc_lvalue) {
   18618             :             /* Can't generate an lvalue "?" in C mode in general. */
   18619           0 :           } else if (is_void_type(lvalue_type)) {
   18620             :             /* Can't generate an lvalue when the result type is void. */
   18621           0 :           } else if (!gcc_lvalue) {
   18622             :             /* See if both branches can be rewritten.  Note that except for
   18623             :                throw cases we know that the two operands have the same type,
   18624             :                because they've been converted to a common type.  That
   18625             :                doesn't guarantee that they can be converted to lvalues. */
   18626           0 :             (void)conv_prvalue_expr_to_lvalue(op2, &op2_possible,
   18627             :                                               /*see_if_possible=*/TRUE,
   18628             :                                               /*gcc_lvalue=*/FALSE,
   18629             :                                               ignore_casts,
   18630             :                                               &lvalue_type);
   18631           0 :             if (!op2_possible &&
   18632           0 :                 skip_parens(op2)->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_throw) {
   18633           0 :               op2_is_throw = TRUE;
   18634           0 :               if (!gpp_mode) op2_possible = TRUE;
   18635             :             }  /* if */
   18636           0 :             (void)conv_prvalue_expr_to_lvalue(op3, &op3_possible,
   18637             :                                               /*see_if_possible=*/TRUE,
   18638             :                                               /*gcc_lvalue=*/FALSE,
   18639             :                                               ignore_casts, &lvalue_type);
   18640           0 :             if (!op3_possible &&
   18641           0 :                 skip_parens(op3)->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_throw) {
   18642           0 :               op3_is_throw = TRUE;
   18643           0 :               if (!gpp_mode) op3_possible = TRUE;
   18644             :             }  /* if */
   18645           0 :             possible = (op2_possible && op3_possible);
   18646             :           } else {
   18647             :             /* Test whether this expression can be rewritten as an lvalue
   18648             :                in gcc mode. */
   18649           0 :             possible = okay_as_gcc_lvalue_question(op2, op3, ignore_casts,
   18650             :                                                    &lvalue_type);
   18651             :           }  /* if */
   18652           0 :           if (possible) {
   18653           0 :             if (!see_if_possible) {
   18654           0 :               node->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue =
   18655             :                                                                           TRUE;
   18656           0 :               node->is_lvalue = TRUE;
   18657           0 :               op2->next = NULL;
   18658           0 :               if (!op2_is_throw) {
   18659           0 :                 op2 = conv_prvalue_expr_to_lvalue(op2, &op2_possible,
   18660             :                                                   /*see_if_possible=*/FALSE,
   18661             :                                                   gcc_lvalue,
   18662             :                                                   ignore_casts,
   18663             :                                                   (a_type_ptr *)NULL);
   18664             :               }  /* if */
   18665           0 :               if (!op3_is_throw) {
   18666           0 :                 op3 = conv_prvalue_expr_to_lvalue(op3, &op3_possible,
   18667             :                                                   /*see_if_possible=*/FALSE,
   18668             :                                                   gcc_lvalue,
   18669             :                                                   ignore_casts,
   18670             :                                                   (a_type_ptr *)NULL);
   18671             :               }  /* if */
   18672           0 :               if (gcc_lvalue) {
   18673             :                 /* For the gcc case, cast the operands to the right result
   18674             :                    type if necessary. */
   18675           0 :                 if (!identical_types(op2->type, lvalue_type)) {
   18676           0 :                   op2 = make_lvalue_cast_node(op2, lvalue_type,
   18677             :                                               /*compiler_generated=*/TRUE);
   18678             :                 }  /* if */
   18679           0 :                 if (!identical_types(op3->type, lvalue_type)) {
   18680           0 :                   op3 = make_lvalue_cast_node(op3, lvalue_type,
   18681             :                                               /*compiler_generated=*/TRUE);
   18682             :                 }  /* if */

   18684           0 :               op1->next = op2;
   18685           0 :               op2->next = op3;
   18686             :             }  /* if */

   18690           0 :       case eok_comma:

   18701             :                                                                           TRUE;
   18702           0 :             op1->next = op2;

   18921           0 : void conv_prvalue_expr_to_object_pointer(an_expr_node_ptr *p_node,
   18922             :                                          a_boolean        *converted)
   18923             : /*

   18943             : 
   18944           0 : an_expr_node_ptr strip_rvalue_base_class_casts(an_expr_node_ptr expr,
   18945             :                                                an_expr_node_ptr *top_cast,
   18946             :                                                an_expr_node_ptr *bottom_cast)
   18947             : /*
   18948             : expr is a class rvalue expression.  If it has any base class casts on top,
   18949             : remove them and save them on the side via *top_cast and *bottom_cast, and

   18984             : 
   18985             : 
   18986           8 : void conv_class_prvalue_operand_to_lvalue(an_operand *operand)
   18987             : /*
   18988             : Convert a prvalue class operand into an operand for an lvalue for the
   18989             : object.  If necessary, this will involve creating a temporary and
   18990             : initializing it from the prvalue.  This routine is used only in C++ mode.
   18991             : */
   18992             : {
   18993           8 :   an_operand        orig_operand;
   18994           8 :   a_boolean         optimized_case;
   18995           8 :   an_expr_node_ptr  node;
   18996             : 
   18997           8 :   if (is_error_operand(operand)) {
   18998           0 :     normalize_error_operand(operand);
   18999             :   } else {
   19000           8 :     check_assertion(is_a_prvalue(operand) &&
   19001             :                     (is_class_struct_union_type(operand->type) ||
   19002             :                      is_template_param_type(operand->type)));
   19003             :     /* The operand is a prvalue.  In general, we will have to copy the
   19004             :        prvalue to a temporary and use the address of the temporary.  However,
   19005             :        there are some cases that can be optimized. */
   19006           8 :     orig_operand = *operand;
   19007           8 :     optimized_case = FALSE;
   19008           8 :     if (is_expression_operand(operand)) {
   19009           8 :       node = operand->variant.expression;
   19010             :       /* Change the prvalue to an lvalue if possible. */
   19011           8 :       node = conv_prvalue_expr_to_lvalue(node, &optimized_case,
   19012             :                                          /*see_if_possible=*/FALSE,
   19013             :                                          /*gcc_lvalue=*/FALSE,
   19014             :                                          /*ignore_casts=*/FALSE,
   19015             :                                          (a_type_ptr *)NULL);
   19016           8 :       if (optimized_case) {
   19017             :         /* The expression has been rewritten as an lvalue. */
   19018           8 :         make_glvalue_expression_operand(node, operand);
   19019             :       } else {
   19020             :         /* Couldn't convert to an lvalue directly.  The prvalue will have to be
   19021             :            copied to a temporary, and an lvalue for the temporary used. */
   19022             :         /* Avoid recursion loops if the class does not allow bitwise copy.
   19023             :            The conversion to an lvalue really must succeed (i.e., it's not
   19024             :            merely an optimization) if a "real" copy constructor would have
   19025             :            to be used, since in that case we would need the address of this
   19026             :            prvalue to be able to call the copy constructor. */
   19027             :         /* Ignore template parameter cases. */
   19028             :         /* Also ignore cases where we're in a prototype instantiation with
   19029             :            a non-real class. */
   19030           0 :         if (is_class_struct_union_type(operand->type) &&
   19031           0 :             !(is_template_dependent_context() &&
   19032           0 :               skip_typerefs(operand->type)->
   19033             :                                 variant.class_struct_union.is_nonreal_class)) {
   19034           0 :           a_class_symbol_supplement_ptr cssp =
   19035           0 :                                     symbol_supplement_for_class(operand->type);
   19036           0 :           if (!cssp->construction_by_bitwise_copy_allowed &&
   19037             :               cssp->has_user_provided_copy_constructor) {
   19038             :             /* Cases like this can come up when an implicitly-generated
   19039             :                copy constructor is later defined explicitly outside the
   19040             :                class. */
   19041             : #if CHECKING
   19042           0 :             if (total_errors == 0) {
   19043             : #if DEBUG
   19044           0 :               db_expression(node);
   19045             : #endif /* DEBUG */
   19046           0 :               internal_error(
   19047             :               "conv_class_prvalue_operand_to_lvalue: couldn't convert to ptr");
   19048             :             }  /* if */
   19049             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   19050           0 :             conv_to_error_operand(operand);
   19051           0 :             optimized_case = TRUE;
   19052             :           }  /* if */
   19053             :         }  /* if */
   19054             :       }  /* if */
   19055             :     }  /* if */
   19056           8 :     if (!optimized_case) {
   19057             :       /* Create a temporary, copy the prvalue into the temporary, and return
   19058             :          an lvalue for the temporary. */
   19059             :       /* Remove any class rvalue base class casts so that we make the
   19060             :          temporary for the derived class and don't slice.  The casts will
   19061             :          be reattached to the new expression below. */
   19062           0 :       an_expr_node_ptr top_cast = NULL, bottom_cast = NULL;
   19063           0 :       if (is_expression_operand(operand)) {
   19064           0 :         node = operand->variant.expression;
   19065           0 :         node = strip_rvalue_base_class_casts(node, &top_cast, &bottom_cast);
   19066           0 :         if (top_cast != NULL) {
   19067             :           /* Some casts were removed, so make the temporary from the derived
   19068             :              class expression. */
   19069           0 :           make_expression_operand(node, operand);
   19070           0 :           restore_operand_details(operand, &orig_operand);
   19071             :         }  /* if */
   19072             :       }  /* if */
   19073           0 :       temp_init_from_operand(operand, /*result_is_lvalue=*/TRUE);
   19074           0 :       if (top_cast != NULL && !is_error_operand(operand)) {
   19075             :         /* Restore the base class casts on top of the initialization of the
   19076             :            temporary. */
   19077           0 :         check_assertion(is_expression_operand(operand));
   19078           0 :         bottom_cast->variant.operation.operands = operand->variant.expression;
   19079             :         /* Change the rvalue casts to lvalue casts. */
   19080           0 :         node = top_cast;
   19081           0 :         check_assertion(is_operation_node(node));
   19082           0 :         if (node_operator_is(node, eok_class_rvalue_adjust)) {
   19083           0 :           set_node_operator(node, (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_lvalue_adjust,
   19084             :                             node->type, /*is_lvalue=*/TRUE,
   19085             :                             node->variant.operation.operands);
   19086           0 :           node = node->variant.operation.operands;
   19087             :         }  /* if */
   19088           0 :         for (;;) {
   19089           0 :           check_assertion(is_operation_node(node) &&
   19090             :                           node_operator_is(node, eok_base_class_cast));
   19091           0 :           node->is_lvalue = TRUE;
   19092           0 :           if (node == bottom_cast) break;
   19093           0 :           node = node->variant.operation.operands;
   19094           0 :           check_assertion(node != NULL);
   19095             :         }  /* for */
   19096           0 :         make_glvalue_expression_operand(top_cast, operand);
   19097             :       }  /* if */
   19098             :     }  /* if */
   19099             :     /* Restore the original source position, etc. */
   19100           8 :     restore_operand_details(operand, &orig_operand);
   19101             :   }  /* if */
   19102           8 : }  /* conv_class_prvalue_operand_to_lvalue */
   19103             : 
   19104             : 
   19105           0 : static an_expr_node_ptr conv_xvalue_expr_to_lvalue(an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   19106             : /*
   19107             : Convert the indicated xvalue expression to an lvalue, and return a pointer
   19108             : to the updated tree.
   19109             : */
   19110             : {
   19111           0 :   a_boolean change_directly = FALSE;
   19112             : 
   19113           0 :   check_assertion(expr->is_xvalue);
   19114           0 :   if (expr->kind == (an_expr_node_kind)enk_temp_init) {
   19115             :     /* A temp-init node can be directly changed to be an lvalue. */
   19116             :     change_directly = TRUE;
   19117           0 :   } else if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
   19118           0 :     an_expr_operator_kind op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   19119           0 :     if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ref_indirect ||
   19120           0 :         op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ref_cast ||
   19121             :         op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_ref_dynamic_cast) {
   19122             :       /* A reference indirection can be directly changed to be an lvalue.
   19123             :          Likewise a reference cast. */
   19124             :       change_directly = TRUE;
   19125             : #if PARENS_IN_IL
   19126             :     } else if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_parens) {
   19127             :       /* For a parenthesis node, do a recursive call to change the subtree,
   19128             :          then change the eok_parens node directly. */
   19129             :       change_directly = TRUE;
   19130             :       expr->variant.operation.operands =
   19131             :                   conv_xvalue_expr_to_lvalue(expr->variant.operation.operands);
   19132             : #endif /* PARENS_IN_IL */
   19133             :     }  /* if */
   19134             :   }  /* if */
   19135             :   if (change_directly) {
   19136           0 :     check_assertion(expr->is_xvalue);
   19137           0 :     expr->is_xvalue = FALSE;
   19138           0 :     expr->is_lvalue = TRUE;
   19139             :   } else {
   19140             :     /* Use a general technique: take a reference to the xvalue and then
   19141             :        indirect through it to get an lvalue. */
   19142           0 :     an_expr_node_ptr ref_expr = add_reference_to_to_node(expr);
   19143           0 :     expr = add_ref_indirection_to_node(ref_expr);
   19144             :   }  /* if */
   19145           0 :   return expr;
   19146             : }  /* conv_xvalue_expr_to_lvalue */

   19149           0 : static void conv_xvalue_to_lvalue(an_operand *operand)

   19170           0 : void conv_class_operand_to_object_pointer(an_operand *operand)

   19250       27408 : static a_constant_ptr value_of_constant_var_glvalue_expr(

   19256             : variable, return a pointer to the constant that is the variable's value.

   19258             : necessary so it's suitable for later incorporation in the IL tree, and not

   19260             : to clear its backing expression; it's assumed the caller will put the

   19445       59790 : an_expr_node_ptr conv_glvalue_expr_to_prvalue(an_expr_node_ptr  node,
   19446             :                                               a_boolean         *constant_case,
   19447             :                                               a_constant_ptr    *con_value,
   19448             :                                               a_source_position *err_pos)
   19449             : /*
   19450             : node is an expression that is a glvalue.  Create an expression for the
   19451             : corresponding prvalue, and return a pointer to it.  node can be a
   19452             : function designator.  If constant_case is non-NULL, look for cases
   19453             : where conversion to a prvalue produces a constant value (e.g., use of
   19454             : a constant-valued variable in C++), and return *constant_case TRUE if
   19455             : the whole glvalue was folded to a constant.  Note that some parts of
   19456             : the glvalue tree might be folded to constants and the overall prvalue
   19457             : might still not be constant, in which case *constant_case is returned
   19458             : FALSE (for example, in "(i ? constvar : j)" constvar would be replaced
   19459             : by its constant value but the overall expression would not fold to a
   19460             : constant).  If constant_case is NULL, do not attempt constant
   19461             : replacement.  If con_value is non-NULL, and the glvalue folds to a
   19462             : constant, *con_value is set to the constant value and NULL is
   19463             : returned.  (In other words, con_value non-NULL is a statement by the
   19464             : caller that he would prefer a constant instead of an expression for
   19465             : the prvalue if it folds to a constant.)  In other cases where con_value
   19466             : is non-NULL, *con_value is returned NULL.  err_pos is non-NULL to
   19467             : provide a position for errors (folding errors, mostly); if it is NULL,
   19468             : no errors will be issued (e.g., folding will not be attempted if
   19469             : it might produce an error).
   19470             : */
   19471             : {
   19472       59790 :   a_constant_ptr con_expr_value = NULL;
   19473       59790 :   a_constant_ptr result_con = local_constant();
   19474       59790 :   a_boolean      processed = FALSE;
   19475       59790 :   a_boolean      template_constant = FALSE;
   19476       59790 :   a_type_ptr     prvalue_node_type;

   19478             :                  saved_position;

   19483       59790 :   saved_position = node->position;
   19484             : #if EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL
   19485       59790 :   saved_expr_range = node->expr_range;

   19515       21451 :       a_variable_ptr variable;
   19516       21451 :       con_expr_value = value_of_constant_var_glvalue_expr(

   19518             :                                                        /*copy_for_reuse=*/TRUE,
   19519             :                                                        &variable);

   19524        1074 :           template_constant = TRUE;

   19991             :           node will also have been set to the prvalue version of the

   20000             :           been set to the prvalue version of the expression.

   20003             :     /* The expression is constant-valued. */
   20004        5378 :     if (node != NULL &&

   20116             : 
   20117       37104 : void conv_glvalue_to_prvalue(an_operand *operand)
   20118             : /*
   20119             : Convert a glvalue operand to a prvalue operand.  See section 6.3.2.1 of the
   20120             : C99 standard and [conv.lval] of the C++ standard.  If the operand is
   20121             : not a glvalue, it is left alone.  Function designators are not considered
   20122             : lvalues here and are left alone.  Note that this routine does not add
   20123             : a copy when it converts a class glvalue to a prvalue in C++ mode;
   20124             : the standard requires that, but it's actually wanted only in some limited
   20125             : cases so we don't do it here.
   20126             : */
   20127             : {
   20128       37104 :   an_expr_node_ptr  node;
   20129       37104 :   an_operand        orig_operand;
   20130       37104 :   a_type_ptr        unqual_operand_type;
   20131       37104 :   a_boolean         constant_case = FALSE;
   20132       37104 :   a_constant_ptr    con_value;
   20133             : 
   20134             :   /* Ignore non-glvalues. */
   20135       37104 :   if (is_a_glvalue(operand)) {
   20136             :     /* A glvalue becomes a prvalue. */
   20137       29808 :     a_boolean  volatile_fetch;
   20138       29808 :     unqual_operand_type = operand->type;
   20139       29808 :     volatile_fetch = is_volatile_qualified_type(unqual_operand_type);
   20140       29808 :     unqual_operand_type = skip_typerefs(unqual_operand_type);
   20141             : #if CHECKING
   20142             :     /* Array glvalues are not allowed. */
   20143       29808 :     if (unqual_operand_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_array) {
   20144           0 :       internal_error("conv_glvalue_to_prvalue: array glvalue");
   20145             :     }  /* if */
   20146             : #endif /* CHECKING */
   20147             :     /* Save the operand's type and source position*/
   20148       29808 :     orig_operand = *operand;
   20149             :     /* Change simple "reference" references to "use" references. */
   20150             :     /* Note that what we want to avoid here is changing "modified" references
   20151             :        to "use" references, as would happen for references surviving
   20152             :        from an lvalue-returning assignment. */
   20153       29808 :     change_some_ref_kinds(operand->ref_entries_list, SRK_REFERENCE, SRK_USE);
   20154             :     /* Change the kind in the reference entry for a subscripted array from an
   20155             :        address-taken entry to a simple "use" reference. */
   20156       29808 :     change_some_ref_kinds(operand->ref_entries_list, SRK_ADDRESS_TAKEN,
   20157             :                           SRK_USE);
   20158             :     /* Instantiate the type if it is a template. */
   20159       29808 :     complete_type_is_needed(unqual_operand_type);
   20160       29808 :     if (is_error_operand(operand)) {
   20161             :       /* Aside from the usual function, the normalization here makes sure the
   20162             :          operand is not a glvalue anymore. */
   20163           0 :       normalize_error_operand(operand);
   20164       29808 :     } else if (unqual_operand_type->incomplete &&
   20165           0 :                !is_managed_nullptr_type(unqual_operand_type) &&
   20166           0 :                (!C_mode() ||
   20167           0 :                 unqual_operand_type->kind != (a_type_kind)tk_void)) {
   20168             :       /* Converting a glvalue with incomplete type to a prvalue is an
   20169             :          error in C++ ([conv.lval]), and undefined behavior in C (C99
   20170             :          6.3.2.1).  We treat it as an error in C mode except when the
   20171             :          lvalue has (possibly cv-qualified) void type.  That latter
   20172             :          qualification is needed to pass DR 106.  In addition, the C++/CLI
   20173             :          managed nullptr type, although prohibited as the type of an
   20174             :          object, etc., is acceptable in an lvalue-to-rvalue conversion. */
   20175           0 :       error_in_operand(ec_incomplete_type_not_allowed, operand);
   20176             :     } else {
   20177       29808 :       using_lvalue(operand);
   20178       29808 :       check_assertion(is_expression_operand(operand));
   20179       29808 :       node = operand->variant.expression;
   20180       29808 :       check_assertion(is_glvalue_node(node));
   20181       29808 :       if (gcc_mode && gcc_const_variables_allowed) {
   20182             :         /* GCC allows const variables to be used in constant expressions in
   20183             :            some C-mode cases, although often only with -O1.  Since the front
   20184             :            end has no -Oxyz options, the behavior is controlled by a separate
   20185             :            gcc_const_variables_allowed variable. */
   20186        5344 :         a_variable_ptr var;
   20187       10263 :         if (operand_is_lvalue_for_variable(operand, &var) &&

   20228       23390 :       } else if (curr_expr_kind_is_traditional_const()) {

   20232       28720 :       } else if (!constexpr_enabled &&
   20233       10660 :                  !potential_gnu_ignored_object_expr(node, curr_token) &&

   20235             :                                                          ec_expr_not_constant,
   20236             :                                                          &operand->position)) {
   20237             :         /* A glvalue cannot be converted to a prvalue in a C++11 constant
   20238             :            expression. */
   20239           0 :         conv_to_error_operand(operand);
   20240             :       } else {

   20242       23390 :         node->volatile_fetch = volatile_fetch;
   20243       23390 :         make_expression_operand(node, operand);
   20244       23390 :         if (operand->type != orig_operand.type &&
   20245        1882 :             unqual_operand_type->kind == (a_type_kind)tk_template_param &&

   20253             :         }  /* if */

   20300        2188 : an_expr_node_ptr conv_array_expr_to_pointer(an_expr_node_ptr node)
   20301             : /*
   20302             : node is an expression for an lvalue or rvalue array.  Do the array-to-pointer
   20303             : decay on it, and return a pointer to the decayed expression.
   20304             : */
   20305             : {
   20306        2188 :   a_boolean  processed = FALSE;
   20307        2188 :   a_type_ptr ptr_type = type_after_array_to_pointer_transformation(node->type);
   20308             : 
   20309             :   /* No skip_parens here; parentheses are handled as an operator below. */
   20310        2188 :   if (is_operation_node(node)) {
   20311         460 :     an_expr_operator_kind op = node->variant.operation.kind;
   20312         460 :     an_expr_node_ptr      op1 = node->variant.operation.operands;
   20313         460 :     an_expr_node_ptr      op2 = op1->next;
   20314         460 :     if (node->variant.operation.returns_lvalue_instead_of_usual_rvalue) {
   20315             :       /* Certain cases of lvalue-returning operations are transformed
   20316             :          by transforming the operands under the operation. */
   20317           0 :       if (op == (an_expr_operator_kind)eok_question) {
   20318           0 :         an_expr_node_ptr op3 = op2->next;
   20319             :         /* Transform a case like
   20320             :              (i ? "ab" : "cd")
   20321             :            by transforming the second and third operands. */
   20322           0 :         op2->next = NULL;

   20324           0 :           op2 = conv_array_expr_to_pointer(op2);

   20327           0 :           op3 = conv_array_expr_to_pointer(op3);
   20328             :         }  /* if */

   20333             :            (i , "cd")

   20362             :           /* Transform a case like
   20363             :                ("ab" >? "cd")

   20365             :              produce lvalues right now, but this code is here in case that's
   20366             :              changed. */

   20371           0 :           op1->next = op2;

   20373           0 :           break;
   20374             : #endif /* GNU_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   20375             :         default:
   20376             :           break;
   20377             :       }  /* switch */
   20378        1728 :     }  /* if */
   20379             :   }  /* if */

   20381             :     /* The node was rewritten above. */
   20382           0 :     node->is_lvalue = node->is_xvalue = FALSE;

   20395             : 
   20396        2188 : void do_array_to_pointer_conversion(an_operand *operand)
   20397             : /*
   20398             : Do array-to-pointer decay on the given operand, which is an lvalue or
   20399             : rvalue of array type.  Don't check whether this decay is valid in the
   20400             : current mode -- just do it.
   20401             : */
   20402             : {
   20403        2188 :   an_expr_node_ptr expr;
   20404        2188 :   a_constant_ptr   conaddr = local_constant();
   20405        2188 :   an_operand       orig_operand;
   20406        2188 :   a_boolean        need_expr = FALSE, need_expr_for_constant = FALSE;
   20407             : 
   20408        2188 :   orig_operand = *operand;
   20409        2188 :   expr = make_node_from_operand(operand);
   20410        2188 :   if (gnu_mode && !is_glvalue_node(expr) &&
   20411           0 :       is_constant_node(skip_parens(expr)) &&
   20412           0 :       (!curr_expr_kind_is_const() || curr_expr_kind_is_traditional_const())) {
   20413             :     /* In GNU mode, some compound literals are taken as array prvalue
   20414             :        constants.  Convert such a constant to an lvalue for a temporary
   20415             :        containing the constant, so we can do array decay on that.  Don't do
   20416             :        this if we must produce a C++11-style constant since (a) the constant
   20417             :        in that case could contain addresses of local variables which cannot
   20418             :        be copied to a file-scope-allocated constant (as done by
   20419             :        make_lvalue_operand_from_compound_constant), and (b) the expression
   20420             :        might be folded below by a call to fold_constexpr_expr. */

   20422           0 :     make_lvalue_operand_from_compound_constant(node_constant(expr), operand);
   20423             :     /* Restore the source position in case we give an error. */
   20424           0 :     restore_operand_details(operand, &orig_operand);
   20425           0 :     expr = make_node_from_operand(operand);
   20426             :   }  /* if */
   20427             :   /* Fold to a constant address if possible and desirable. */
   20428        2188 :   if (curr_expr_kind_is_traditional_const() &&
   20429             :       curr_expr_kind_is(ek_integral_constant)) {
   20430             :     /* Array-to-pointer decay is not allowed in an integral constant

   20446          45 :     make_constant_operand(conaddr, operand);

   20449        1212 :   } else if (curr_expr_kind_is_evaluated_const() &&

   20455             :   } else {

   20484             : 
   20485        2188 : void conv_array_operand_to_pointer_operand(an_operand *operand)
   20486             : /*
   20487             : Apply the implicit array to pointer-to-first-element-of-array transformation
   20488             : to the operand.  If the operand is an array lvalue it is changed to a prvalue
   20489             : pointer to the first element of the array.  If the operand is an array rvalue,
   20490             : the conversion is done in some modes (C++, C99) and not in others.  All other
   20491             : cases are left alone.
   20492             : */
   20493             : {
   20494        2188 :   if (is_array_type(operand->type)) {
   20495        2188 :     a_boolean do_decay = FALSE;
   20496        2188 :     if (is_an_lvalue(operand)) {
   20497             :       do_decay = TRUE;
   20498           0 :     } else if (is_an_rvalue(operand) &&
   20499           0 :                (!C_mode() || c99_mode || gcc_mode || microsoft_mode)) {
   20500             :       /* In C++ or C99 (but not in older C), an array rvalue is converted
   20501             :          to a pointer to its first element.  Make an lvalue so the
   20502             :          conversion below will apply.  GNU and Microsoft C also behave as
   20503             :          required by C99. */
   20504             :       do_decay = TRUE;
   20505             :     }  /* if */
   20506             :     if (do_decay) {
   20507        2188 :       do_array_to_pointer_conversion(operand);
   20508             :     }  /* if */
   20509             :   }  /* if */
   20510        2188 : }  /* conv_array_operand_to_pointer_operand */

   20623       16187 : void conv_expr_function_designator_to_ptr_to_function(
   20624             :                                          an_operand        *operand,
   20625             :                                          a_boolean         will_call,
   20626             :                                          a_source_position *ampersand_position)
   20627             : /*
   20628             : Convert an expression-form function designator in *operand into a
   20629             : prvalue for the address of the function.  Note that for nonstatic member
   20630             : functions this produces a pointer, not a pointer to member, which
   20631             : is what's wanted for the function-identifying operand of a call.
   20632             : will_call is TRUE if the resulting expression will be used to call the
   20633             : function, which means (among other things) that its address will not escape.
   20634             : If ampersand_position is non-NULL, the function reference is preceded
   20635             : by an "&" operator and *ampersand_position gives its position.
   20636             : */

   20645       16187 :   a_type_ptr       rtp = NULL;

   20762             : 
   20763       23725 : void conv_function_designator_to_ptr_to_function(
   20764             :                                          an_operand        *operand,
   20765             :                                          a_source_position *ampersand_position,
   20766             :                                          a_boolean         allow_ctor,
   20767             :                                          a_boolean         will_call)
   20768             : /*
   20769             : Convert a function designator operand to a pointer to function
   20770             : operand.  If ampersand_position is non-NULL, this is being done
   20771             : because of an "&" operator in the source, and *ampersand_position
   20772             : gives the position of that operator; otherwise, this is an implicit
   20773             : decay.  Also handles pointers to members, including the nonstandard
   20774             : case of that where no explicit "&" appears.  allow_ctor is TRUE if
   20775             : this operation is allowed if the operand is a constructor (ordinarily,
   20776             : taking the address of a constructor is not allowed).  will_call is
   20777             : TRUE if the resulting operand will be used to call the function, which
   20778             : means (among other things) that its address will not escape.  Note
   20779             : that a bound function lvalue for a nonstatic member function gets
   20780             : turned into a pointer, not a pointer to member; that's weird, but it's
   20781             : used in generating the function-identifying operand in a call.
   20782             : */
   20783             : {
   20784       23725 :   an_operand orig_operand;
   20785       23725 :   a_boolean  set_operand_of_ampersand = FALSE;
   20786             : 
   20787             :   /* If you change this routine, see also the code in
   20788             :      type_after_function_to_pointer_transformation that does a similar
   20789             :      transformation without generating errors. */

   20915             : a_symbol_ptr get_property_accessor_symbol(a_symbol_ptr       property_sym,
   20916             :                                           a_boolean          put,
   20917             :                                           a_boolean          must_be_present,
   20918             :                                           a_source_position  *pos)
   20919             : /*
   20920             : property_sym points to a field or property set associated with a Microsoft
   20921             : property.  (Both old-style __declspec properties and C++/CLI properties are
   20922             : handled here.)  Get and return the symbol for the accessor function, either
   20923             : for "get" (put == FALSE) or "put"/"set" (put == TRUE).  Return NULL if there
   20924             : is no such symbol.  In that case, if must_be_present is TRUE also put out an
   20925             : error.  The source position of the reference is given by pos.
   20926             : */
   20927             : {
   20928             :   a_symbol_ptr getput_sym = NULL;
   20929             :

   20945             :       }  /* if */

   20998             : 
   20999             : void rewrite_property_reference(
   21000             :                               an_operand                          *operand,
   21001             :                               an_operand                          *put_operand,
   21002             :                               a_rewritten_property_reference_kind kind,
   21003             :                               a_routine_ptr                       *get_routine)
   21004             : /*
   21005             : *operand is an operand for a reference to a class member declared as
   21006             : a Microsoft property (either using __declspec(property) or the C++/CLI
   21007             : property syntax).  Transform it to a call of an accessor routine.  The
   21008             : access is a "put" if put_operand is non-NULL (and *put_operand gives
   21009             : the value to be put); the access is a "get" if put_operand is NULL.
   21010             : When put_operand is non-NULL, kind indicates the kind of operator
   21011             : being rewritten; it's used to set a kind in the expression created.
   21012             : If get_routine is non-NULL, *get_routine is set to a pointer to the
   21013             : "get" function selected, if everything goes okay, or to NULL otherwise.
   21014             : */
   21015             : {
   21016             :   a_symbol_ptr      property_sym = operand->symbol, getput_sym;
   21017             :   a_source_position operand_position;

   21019             :   a_source_position operand_end_position;
   21020             :   a_source_position operand_id_position;
   21021             : #endif /* EXTRA_SOURCE_POSITIONS_IN_IL */
   21022             : 
   21023             :   if (get_routine != NULL) *get_routine = NULL;
   21024             :   operand_position = operand->position;

   21035             :     /* Some error. */

   21038             :     an_operand           orig_operand, function_operand, selector;
   21039             :     an_arg_list_elem_ptr arg_list;

   21043             :     have_selector = (operand->variant.property_ref.object != NULL);

   21143             :                accessor. */

   21155             :           /* The processing above left the starting source position of the
   21156             :              enk_routine node being that of the beginning of the object

   21172             :          token, which is past the end of the field reference.  Restore
