   21195             : 
   21196             : void rewrite_event_operator(an_operand         *lhs,
   21197             :                             an_operand         *rhs,
   21198             :                             an_operand         *result,
   21199             :                             a_token_kind       operator_token,
   21200             :                             a_source_position  *operator_pos,
   21201             :                             a_boolean          *p_err)
   21202             : /*
   21203             : An expression "lhs @= rhs" has been scanned with lhs an event reference.
   21204             : Produce in *result an operand rewriting that expression as a call to the
   21205             : event's "add" or "remove" accessor.  operator_token and operator_pos describe
   21206             : the compound assignment operator token (only "+=" and "-=" are valid; other
   21207             : assignment operators trigger a diagnostic).  If an error occurs, *p_err is set
   21208             : to TRUE and *result becomes an error operand.
   21209             : */
   21210             : {
   21211             :   a_boolean  err = FALSE;
   21212             : 
   21213             :   check_assertion(is_event_ref_operand(lhs));
   21214             :   if (operator_token != tok_plus_assign &&
   21215             :       operator_token != tok_minus_assign) {
   21216             :     expr_pos_error(ec_bad_event_compound_assignment, operator_pos);
   21217             :     err = TRUE;
   21218             :   } else {
   21219             :     a_property_or_event_descr_ptr
   21220             :                          pedp = NULL;
   21221             :     a_symbol_ptr         event_sym = lhs->symbol, accessor_sym = NULL;
   21222             :     a_symbol_locator     accessor_loc;
   21223             :     an_operand           function_operand, selector;
   21224             :     an_arg_list_elem_ptr arg_list = NULL;
   21225             :     an_operand           orig_operand;
   21226             :     an_expr_node_ptr     argument_list;
   21227             :     a_boolean            have_selector =
   21228             :                                        (lhs->variant.event_ref.object != NULL);
   21229             : 
   21230             :     /* Copy the original operand before any modifications occur. */
   21231             :     orig_operand = *lhs;
   21232             :     if (symbol_is(event_sym, sk_field)) {
   21233             :       pedp = event_sym->variant.field.ptr->property_or_event_descr;
   21234             :     } else if (symbol_is(event_sym, sk_static_data_member)) {
   21235             :       pedp = event_sym->variant.static_data_member.variable
   21236             :                                          ->property_or_event_descr;
   21237             :     } else {
   21238             :       unexpected_condition();
   21239             :     }  /* if */
   21240             :     if (operator_token == tok_plus_assign && pedp->add_routine != NULL) {
   21241             :       accessor_sym = symbol_for(pedp->add_routine);
   21242             :     } else if (operator_token == tok_minus_assign &&
   21243             :                pedp->remove_routine != NULL) {
   21244             :       accessor_sym = symbol_for(pedp->remove_routine);
   21245             :     } else {
   21246             :       err = TRUE;
   21247             :     }  /* if */
   21248             :     if (!err) {
   21249             :       if (have_selector) {
   21250             :         /* A selector object was specified.  It may or may not be used in the
   21251             :            accessor call depending on whether a static or nonstatic property is
   21252             :            selected by overload resolution.  If it isn't bound, it will be
   21253             :            added in via a comma operator below. */
   21254             :         make_expression_operand(lhs->variant.event_ref.object, &selector);
   21255             :         selector.selector_is_object_pointer = TRUE;
   21256             :       }  /* if */
   21257             :       make_locator_for_symbol(accessor_sym, &accessor_loc);
   21258             :       accessor_loc.source_position = *operator_pos;
   21259             :       check_ambiguity_and_verify_access(&accessor_loc);
   21260             :       /* Turn the right-hand side into an operand list for the call. */
   21261             :       arg_list = alloc_arg_list_elem_for_operand(rhs);
   21262             :       /* Do overload resolution to determine the function to call. */
   21263             :       if (!select_and_prepare_to_call_overloaded_function(
   21264             :                                           accessor_sym,
   21265             :                                           /*is_template_id=*/FALSE,
   21266             :                                           (a_template_arg_ptr)NULL,
   21267             :                                           have_selector,
   21268             :                                           &selector,
   21269             :                                           arg_list,
   21270             :                                           /*do_arg_dep_lookup=*/FALSE,
   21271             :                                           /*use_pure_arg_dep_lookup=*/FALSE,
   21272             :                                           /*use_std_for_arg_dep_lookup=*/FALSE,
   21273             :                                           /*try_surrogate_functions=*/FALSE,
   21274             :                                           /*is_property=*/FALSE,
   21275             :                                           /*compiler_generated=*/TRUE,
   21276             :                                           ec_no_matching_function,
   21277             :                                           ec_ambiguous_overloaded_function,
   21278             :                                           ec_undefined_identifier,
   21279             :                                           (an_operand *)NULL,
   21280             :                                           operator_pos,
   21281             :                                           (a_token_sequence_number)0,
   21282             :                                           (a_source_position *)NULL,
   21283             :                                           (a_boolean *)NULL,
   21284             :                                           &function_operand,
   21285             :                                           &argument_list)) {
   21286             :         /* Some error. */
   21287             :         err = TRUE;
   21288             :       } else {
   21289             :         /* Create the function call. */
   21290             :         an_expr_node_ptr  func_call_node;
   21291             :         a_boolean         virtual_function, bound_function;
   21292             :         if (lhs->is_qualified_name) {
   21293             :           /* If the left-hand operand used a qualified name to refer to the
   21294             :              event, the accessor call is never virtual. */
   21295             :           function_operand.virtual_function = FALSE;
   21296             :         }  /* if */
   21297             :         /* Generally speaking, we want to restore the original operand details,
   21298             :            but the "virtual_function" and "bound_function" flags should reflect
   21299             :            the nature of the call. */
   21300             :         bound_function = function_operand.bound_function;
   21301             :         virtual_function = function_operand.virtual_function;

   21303             :                                             !orig_operand.is_qualified_name;

   21308             :                                /*qualified_function_name=*/FALSE,
   21309             :                                /*found_through_adl=*/FALSE,
   21310             :                                /*uses_operator_syntax=*/FALSE,
   21311             :                                operator_pos, result,
   21312             :                                /*p_folded=*/(a_boolean*)NULL, &func_call_node);
   21313             : #if !DO_IL_LOWERING

   21315             :           an_expr_node_ptr opnd = func_call_node->variant.operation.operands;
   21316             :           if (is_routine_node(opnd)) {
   21317             :             /* Record the information about the event in the enk_routine
   21318             :                node to indicate that the call resulted from a transformed

   21320             :                accessor. */

   21322             :             a_name_reference_ptr  nrp = alloc_name_reference();

   21324             :             nrp->variant.property_or_event_descr =
   21325             :                                            rp->variant.property_or_event_descr;

   21327             :           }  /* if */
   21328             :         }  /* if */
   21329             : #endif /* !DO_IL_LOWERING */
   21330             :       }  /* if */
   21331             :     }  /* if */
   21332             :     free_arg_list(arg_list);
   21333             :   }  /* if */
   21334             :   if (err) {
   21335             :     make_error_operand(result);
   21336             :     operand_will_not_be_used_because_of_error(lhs);
   21337             :     operand_will_not_be_used_because_of_error(rhs);
   21338             :     *p_err = TRUE;
   21339             :   }  /* if */
   21340             : }  /* rewrite_event_operator  */
   21341             : 
   21342             : 
   21343             : void rewrite_event_ref_for_call(an_operand        *operand,
   21344             :                                 an_operand        *bound_function_selector)
   21345             : /*
   21346             : operand describes an event reference for an event invocation.  Replace the
   21347             : operand to be a member function designation for the event's "raise" accessor
   21348             : (or issue a diagnostic and make the operand an error operand if there is no
   21349             : such accessor).  For non-static events, set *bound_function_selector to the
   21350             : selector expression used to designate the event.
   21351             : */
   21352             : {
   21353             :   a_property_or_event_descr_ptr  pedp = NULL;

   21405             : #endif /* !DO_IL_LOWERING */

   21407             :       make_expression_operand(selector, bound_function_selector);

   21422             : 
   21423             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   21424             : 
   21425           0 : void call_named_member_function(an_operand           *selector_operand,

   21434             :         expr.member(a1, a2, ...)

   21568             : 
   21569           0 : void call_adl_named_function(a_const_char            *func_name,
   21570             :                              a_template_arg_ptr      templ_arg_list,
   21571             :                              an_arg_list_elem_ptr    alep,
   21572             :                              a_source_position       *pos,
   21573             :                              a_token_sequence_number tok_seq_number,
   21574             :                              an_error_code           err_none_applies,
   21575             :                              an_error_code           err_ambiguous,
   21576             :                              an_error_code           err_undefined_identifier,
   21577             :                              an_operand              *result,
   21578             :                              an_expr_node_ptr        *call_node)
   21579             : /*
   21580             : Create in *result the representation of a call of the form
   21581             : 
   21582             :         func<...>(a1, a2, ...)
   21583             : 
   21584             : or
   21585             : 
   21586             :         func(a1, a2, ...)
   21587             : 
   21588             : (if templ_arg_list is NULL) where func is determined by looking up func_name
   21589             : strictly through argument-dependent lookup (i.e., ordinary lookup is not done),
   21590             : the template argument list is represented by templ_arg_list (NULL means there
   21591             : is none), and a1, a2, ... is represented by alep (possibly NULL).
   21592             : tok_seq_number is the token sequence number from where the lookup of func_name
   21593             : should be done.  pos is the position to use for this call.
   21594             : 
   21595             : err_none_applies, err_ambiguous, and err_undefined_identifier are error codes
   21596             : to be issued when, respectively, functions are found but none are viable,
   21597             : functions are found but overload resolution is ambiguous, and no functions are
   21598             : found.
   21599             : 
   21600             : If call_node is non-NULL, set *call_node to the node representing the actual
   21601             : call.
   21602             : */
   21603             : {
   21604           0 :   a_symbol_locator     loc;
   21605           0 :   a_symbol_ptr         sym;
   21606           0 :   an_expr_stack_entry  expr_stack_entry;

   21609           0 :   an_expr_node_ptr     arg_nodes;
   21610             : 
   21611           0 :   clear_locator(&loc, pos);
   21612           0 :   (void)find_symbol(func_name, strlen(func_name), &loc);
   21613           0 :   sym = make_dummy_undefined_symbol(loc.symbol_header, &loc.source_position);

   21615             :                   /*force_object_lifetime=*/FALSE,
   21616             :                   /*suppress_object_lifetime=*/FALSE);
   21617             :   /* Determine which function will be called. */
   21618           0 :   if (select_and_prepare_to_call_overloaded_function(
   21619             :                                      sym,
   21620             :                                      /*is_template_id=*/templ_arg_list != NULL,
   21621             :                                      templ_arg_list,
   21622             :                                      /*have_selector=*/FALSE,
   21623             :                                      (an_operand *)NULL,
   21624             :                                      alep,
   21625             :                                      /*do_arg_dep_lookup=*/TRUE,
   21626             :                                      /*use_pure_arg_dep_lookup=*/TRUE,
   21627             :                                      /*use_std_for_arg_dep_lookup=*/TRUE,
   21628             :                                      /*try_surrogate_functions=*/FALSE,
   21629             :                                      /*is_property=*/FALSE,

   21666        2704 : void convert_function_template_to_single_function_full(
   21667             :                                                 an_operand    *operand,
   21668             :                                                 a_boolean     will_call,
   21669             :                                                 a_symbol_ptr  *single_func_sym,
   21670             :                                                 a_boolean     *dependent)
   21671             : /*
   21672             : If operand is a reference to a function template with explicit template
   21673             : arguments that reduces to a single function, change the operand to that
   21674             : function.  See Core Issue 115.  If will_call is TRUE, the resulting function
   21675             : will be called immediately (as opposed to, say, having its address taken).
   21676             : If single_func_sym is non-NULL, return the symbol for the single function
   21677             : in *single_func_sym, or set that to NULL if there is no single function.
   21678             : If dependent is non-NULL, set it to TRUE if the operand is dependent, FALSE
   21679             : otherwise.
   21680             : */

   21682        2704 :   if (single_func_sym != NULL) *single_func_sym = NULL;

   21867             : 
   21868      670159 : void do_operand_transformations(an_operand                   *operand,
   21869             :                                 a_transformation_options_set options)
   21870             : /*
   21871             : Do some implicit operand transformations on the indicated operand.
   21872             : The transformations are:
   21873             :   (1)  Conversion of a function designator to a pointer-to-function.
   21874             :   (2)  Conversion of an array glvalue to pointer-to-first-element.
   21875             :   (3)  (Not really a transformation, but...) Checking for indefinite functions.
   21876             :   (4)  Conversion of a glvalue to a prvalue.
   21877             :   (5)  Conversion of a reference to a member declared as a Microsoft
   21878             :        property to a call of the appropriate "get" function, and
   21879             :        similarly for event references.
   21880             :   (6)  (Also not really a transformation...) Checking for braced-init-lists
   21881             :        not handled explicitly elsewhere.
   21882             : The flags in options can be used to suppress one or more of these
   21883             : transformations.
   21884             : */
   21885             : {
   21886      670159 :   a_boolean will_call = (options & TOPT_WILL_CALL) != 0;
   21887             : 
   21888             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   21889             :   if (microsoft_mode) {
   21890             :     if (is_property_ref_operand(operand)) {
   21891             :       if (!(options & TOPT_SUPPRESS_RVALUE_PROPERTY_REWRITE)) {
   21892             :         /* This operand is a reference to a member declared as a Microsoft
   21893             :            property.  Change it to a call of the appropriate "get" function. */
   21894             :         rewrite_property_reference(operand, (an_operand *)NULL,
   21895             :                                 (a_rewritten_property_reference_kind)rprk_none,
   21896             :                                    (a_routine_ptr *)NULL);
   21897             :       }  /* if */
   21898             :     } else if (is_event_ref_operand(operand)) {
   21899             :       /* Events cannot be accessed as rvalues. */
   21900             :       error_in_operand(ec_invalid_event_use, operand);
   21901             :     }  /* if */
   21902             :   }  /* if */
   21903             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   21904      670159 :   if (is_array_type(operand->type)) {
   21905             :     /* An array lvalue or rvalue. */
   21906        2623 :     if (!(options & TOPT_SUPPRESS_ARRAY_TO_POINTER_CONVERSION)) {
   21907             :       /* In most contexts, an operand of array type is changed to
   21908             :          "pointer to first element of array". */
   21909        2188 :       conv_array_operand_to_pointer_operand(operand);
   21910             :     }  /* if */
   21911      667536 :   } else if (is_a_glvalue(operand)) {
   21912             :     /* A non-array glvalue. */
   21913       61232 :     if (!(options & TOPT_SUPPRESS_LVALUE_TO_RVALUE_CONVERSION)) {
   21914             :       /* Convert a glvalue to a prvalue. */
   21915       28963 :       if ((options & TOPT_COPY_CLASS_ON_CONV_TO_RVALUE) &&
   21916         190 :           !C_mode() &&
   21917          90 :           is_class_struct_union_type(operand->type) &&
   21918           0 :           !is_incomplete_type(operand->type) /* For error recovery. */
   21919             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   21920             :            && !is_managed_class_type(operand->type)
   21921             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   21922             :                                                     ) {
   21923             :         /* When converting a class object to a prvalue in C++ mode, make a
   21924             :            copy.  This is required by the standard, but it only applies in
   21925             :            some unusual situations, so it's not the default. */
   21926           0 :         temp_init_from_operand(operand, /*result_is_lvalue=*/FALSE);
   21927             :       } else {
   21928       28963 :         conv_glvalue_to_prvalue(operand);
   21929             :       }  /* if */
   21930             :     }  /* if */
   21931             :   }  /* if */
   21932      670159 :   if (is_indefinite_function_operand(operand) &&
   21933       15436 :       !(options & TOPT_SUPPRESS_CHECK_FOR_INDEFINITE_FUNCTION)) {
   21934             :     /* Issue an error for an indefinite function (i.e., a C++ overloaded
   21935             :        function that wasn't called, so we were never able to determine
   21936             :        which function was intended). */
   21937             :     /* Try to convert a template with explicit arguments to a single
   21938             :        function. */
   21939           0 :     convert_function_template_to_single_function_if_possible(operand,
   21940             :                                                              will_call);
   21941           0 :     error_if_indefinite_function(operand);
   21942             :   }  /* if */
   21943      670159 :   if (is_a_function_designator(operand)) {
   21944       23733 :     if (is_sym_for_member_operand(operand) ?
   21945           0 :                     (options & TOPT_SUPPRESS_MEMBER_FUNC_TO_PM_CONVERSION) :
   21946             :                     (options & TOPT_SUPPRESS_FUNCTION_TO_POINTER_CONVERSION)) {
   21947             :       /* The applicable pointer-to-function conversion is suppressed. */
   21948             :     } else {
   21949             :       /* In most contexts, an entity of type "function returning type"
   21950             :          is changed to "pointer to function returning type".  
   21951             :          See section 3.2.2.1 in the ANSI C standard.  Also, member function
   21952             :          to pointer to member (not a standard conversion, but allowed as
   21953             :          an accommodation to existing practice). */
   21954             :       /* In Microsoft mode, allow an explicit call of a constructor, e.g.,
   21955             :          "p->X::X()". */
   21956       23443 :       a_boolean allow_ctor = (will_call && ms_extensions);
   21957       23443 :       conv_function_designator_to_ptr_to_function(operand,
   21958             :                                                   (a_source_position *)NULL,
   21959             :                                                   allow_ctor,
   21960             :                                                   will_call);
   21961             :     }  /* if */
   21962      646426 :   } else if (is_braced_init_list_operand(operand)) {

   21964             :        is no option to suppress this. */
   21965           0 :     check_arg_list_elem_is_expression(operand->variant.braced_init_list);

   21967             :   }  /* if */
   21968      670159 : }  /* do_operand_transformations */
   21969             : 
   21970             : 
   21971           0 : static a_boolean expr_gets_volatile_lvalue_to_rvalue_conv(
   21972             :                                                          an_expr_node_ptr expr)
   21973             : /*
   21974             : Return TRUE if the expression expr has one of the forms described in
   21975             : [expr]p11 for discarded-value expressions that get the glvalue-to-prvalue
   21976             : conversion for a volatile glvalue.
   21977             : */
   21978             : {
   21979           0 :   a_boolean do_conv = FALSE;
   21980             : 
   21981           0 :   expr = skip_parens(expr);
   21982           0 :   if (is_variable_node(expr)) {
   21983             :     /* id-expression. */
   21984             :     do_conv = TRUE;
   21985           0 :   } else if (is_operation_node(expr)) {
   21986           0 :     an_expr_operator_kind op = expr->variant.operation.kind;
   21987           0 :     an_expr_node_ptr      op1 = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   21988           0 :     switch (op) {
   21989           0 :       case eok_subscript:
   21990             :       case eok_dot_field:
   21991             :       case eok_points_to_field:
   21992             :       case eok_indirect:
   21993             :       case eok_pm_field:
   21994             :       case eok_pm_points_to_field:
   21995           0 :         do_conv = TRUE;
   21996           0 :         break;
   21997           0 :       case eok_question:
   21998             :       case eok_vector_question:
   21999             :         /* "?" gets the conversion if both the 2nd and 3rd operands do. */
   22000           0 :         do_conv = (expr_gets_volatile_lvalue_to_rvalue_conv(op1->next) &&
   22001           0 :                    expr_gets_volatile_lvalue_to_rvalue_conv(op1->next->next));
   22002             :         break;
   22003           0 :       case eok_comma:
   22004             :         /* "," gets the conversion if the 2nd operand does. */
   22005           0 :         do_conv = expr_gets_volatile_lvalue_to_rvalue_conv(op1->next);
   22006           0 :         break;
   22007             :       default:
   22008             :         break;
   22009             :     }  /* switch */
   22010           0 :   }  /* if */
   22011           0 :   return do_conv;
   22012             : }  /* expr_gets_volatile_lvalue_to_rvalue_conv */
   22013             : 
   22014             : 
   22015       16968 : void do_void_operand_transformations(an_operand *operand,
   22016             :                                      a_boolean  force_lvalue_to_rvalue)
   22017             : /*
   22018             : Do whatever transformations are appropriate on a void expression operand,
   22019             : e.g., lvalue-to-rvalue in C, not in C++.  If force_lvalue_to_rvalue is
   22020             : TRUE, the lvalue-to-rvalue (etc.) transformations are forced even in C++ mode.
   22021             : */
   22022             : {
   22023       16968 :   a_transformation_options_set options = TOPT_NO_OPTIONS;
   22024             : 
   22025       16968 :   if (!C_mode() && !force_lvalue_to_rvalue) {
   22026             :     /* In C++, lvalue-to-rvalue transformations are not done on an expression
   22027             :        scanned as a void expression. */
   22028       13984 :     options = TOPT_SUPPRESS_LVALUE_TO_RVALUE_CONVERSION;
   22029       13984 :     if ((cpp11_mode || gpp_mode) &&
   22030       13984 :         is_volatile_qualified_type(operand->type)) {
   22031             :       /* C++11 requires an lvalue-to-rvalue conversion on lvalues with a
   22032             :          volatile type that have a certain form.  g++ seems to have done this
   22033             :          (or just the C semantics) all along. */
   22034           0 :       if (is_expression_operand(operand) &&
   22035           0 :           expr_gets_volatile_lvalue_to_rvalue_conv(
   22036             :                                                 operand->variant.expression)) {
   22037             :         /* Do not suppress the lvalue-to-rvalue conversion. */
   22038           0 :         options = TOPT_NO_OPTIONS;
   22039             :       }  /* if */
   22040             :     }  /* if */
   22041             :     /* The array-to-pointer and function-to-pointer conversions are
   22042             :        suppressed in all cases in C++ mode. */
   22043       13984 :     options |= (TOPT_SUPPRESS_ARRAY_TO_POINTER_CONVERSION |
   22044             :                 TOPT_SUPPRESS_FUNCTION_TO_POINTER_CONVERSION);
   22045             :   }  /* if */
   22046       16968 :   do_operand_transformations(operand, options);
   22047       16968 : }  /* do_void_operand_transformations */
   22048             : 
   22049             : 
   22050       26581 : void eliminate_unusual_operand_kinds(an_operand *operand)
   22051             : /*
   22052             : Eliminate unusual operand kinds, e.g., indefinite functions and
   22053             : symbol-for-member operands, possibly by giving errors for them.
   22054             : This can be used to guarantee that going forward the operand will have
   22055             : one of the "normal" kinds.
   22056             : */
   22057             : {
   22058       26581 :   do_operand_transformations(operand,
   22059             :                              (TOPT_SUPPRESS_LVALUE_TO_RVALUE_CONVERSION |
   22060             :                               TOPT_SUPPRESS_ARRAY_TO_POINTER_CONVERSION |
   22061             :                               TOPT_SUPPRESS_FUNCTION_TO_POINTER_CONVERSION));
   22062       26581 : }  /* eliminate_unusual_operand_kinds */
   22063             : 
   22064             : 
   22065           0 : a_boolean still_an_lvalue(a_type_ptr type_before_cast,
   22066             :                           a_type_ptr type_cast_to)
   22067             : /*
   22068             : In pcc, SVR4, and Microsoft C modes certain lvalues when cast remain as lvalues
   22069             : after the cast.  Return TRUE if a cast with the before/after types given
   22070             : should leave its result still an lvalue.  This routine is called only in
   22071             : C mode.
   22072             : */
   22073             : {
   22074           0 :   a_boolean is_still_an_lvalue = FALSE;
   22075             :   /* Be sure to retrieve the alignment before skipping typerefs in case this
   22076             :      is ever called in GNU mode (where attributes can change the alignment
   22077             :      of typedef types). */
   22078           0 :   a_targ_alignment  
   22079           0 :             alignment_before_cast = alignment_of_type(type_before_cast),
   22080           0 :             alignment_after_cast = alignment_of_type(type_cast_to);
   22081             :                      
   22082           0 :   type_before_cast = skip_typerefs(type_before_cast);
   22083           0 :   type_cast_to = skip_typerefs(type_cast_to);
   22084             : 
   22085           0 :   check_assertion(C_mode());
   22086           0 :   if (!is_scalar_type(type_before_cast) ||
   22087           0 :       !is_scalar_type(type_cast_to)) {
   22088             :     /* Rule out casts from/to structs. */
   22089             :     /* is_still_an_lvalue = FALSE; -- already set. */
   22090           0 :   } else if (identical_types(type_cast_to, type_before_cast)) {
   22091             :     /* Same type, operand stays an lvalue. */
   22092             :     is_still_an_lvalue = TRUE;
   22093           0 :   } else if (!ms_extensions &&
   22094           0 :              (is_floating_type(type_before_cast) ||
   22095           0 :               is_floating_type(type_cast_to))) {
   22096             :     /* The source or destination types are floating types, so there's
   22097             :        actual conversion involved. */
   22098             :     /* is_still_an_lvalue = FALSE; -- already set. */
   22099           0 :   } else if (is_bool_type(type_cast_to)) {
   22100             :     /* Conversion between other types and bool maps zero/non-zero to
   22101             :        false/true, so it's a real conversion. */
   22102             :     /* is_still_an_lvalue = FALSE; -- already set. */
   22103           0 :   } else if (type_cast_to->size == type_before_cast->size &&
   22104             :              alignment_after_cast == alignment_before_cast) {
   22105             :     /* The types are not floating or bool types, and they have the same size
   22106             :        and alignment. */
   22107           0 :     is_still_an_lvalue = TRUE;
   22108             : #if MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED
   22109             :   } else if (ms_extensions &&
   22110             :              (is_integral_or_enum_type(type_before_cast) ||
   22111             :               is_pointer_type(type_before_cast)) &&
   22112             :              is_integral_or_enum_type(type_cast_to)) {
   22113             :     /* In Microsoft C mode lvalue casts involving integral types of different
   22114             :        sizes are allowed -- e.g.,
   22115             :          long l; ++(char)l;   // affects only the low-order 8 bits
   22116             :        Also casts of pointer types to integral type.
   22117             :     */
   22118             :     is_still_an_lvalue = TRUE;
   22119             : #endif /* MICROSOFT_EXTENSIONS_ALLOWED */
   22120             :   }  /* if */
   22121             : 
   22122           0 :   return is_still_an_lvalue;
   22123             : }  /* still_an_lvalue */

   22126        1959 : static void examine_expr_for_auto_object(
   22127             :                                     an_expr_node_ptr                    expr,
   22128             :                                     an_expr_or_stmt_traversal_block_ptr tblock)
   22129             : /*
   22130             : Called from the expression traversal routines to process an expression
   22131             : as part of determining whether its underlying object is auto.  The
   22132             : expression passed in is an addressing expression, meaning either a glvalue
   22133             : that identifies an object or a prvalue that is a pointer to an object.

   22136        1959 :   if (is_glvalue_node(expr) ||
   22137        1128 :       (tblock->follow_class_rvalue_addressing_path &&
   22138           0 :        is_class_struct_union_type(expr->type))) {
   22139             :     /* The expression passed in is a glvalue for an object (or a class

   22142         831 :            node_operator_is(expr, eok_lvalue_cast)) {
   22143             :       /* Skip lvalue cast nodes. */
   22144           0 :       expr = expr->variant.operation.operands;
   22145             :     }  /* while */

   22147           0 :       a_variable_ptr var = node_variable(expr);
   22148           0 :       if (!var_has_static_or_thread_storage_duration(var)) {
   22149             :         /* An lvalue for a nonstatic local variable or a parameter. */

   22186         572 : a_boolean is_glvalue_for_auto_object(an_expr_node_ptr expr,

   22188             : /*
   22189             : Return TRUE if expr is a glvalue whose underlying object is known to
   22190             : be an automatic (stack-based) entity.  The safe answer is FALSE.  If the

   22286             : 
   22287      177378 : a_boolean check_boolean_controlling_expr(an_operand *operand)
   22288             : /*
   22289             : Do some checks on a boolean controlling expression (e.g., "i != 0" in 
   22290             : "(i != 0) ? j : k").  Check that (if bool is enabled) it has bool type
   22291             : or can be converted to it, or (if bool is disabled) it's a scalar
   22292             : (arithmetic or pointer) or a pointer to member; return FALSE if not.
   22293             : Also, convert the expression to bool if bool is enabled.
   22294             : This routine does not attempt conversions from class types to built-in
   22295             : types to get a boolean expression (see process_boolean_controlling_expression).
   22296             : That's convenient for operands of potentially-overloaded operators, because
   22297             : the search for conversions to the right operand types is handled
   22298             : by check_for_operator_overloading.  In modern C++ modes, this routine
   22299             : implements "contextually converted to bool" (C++11 [conv]p4) except for
   22300             : user-defined conversions.
   22301             : */
   22302             : {
   22303      177378 :   a_boolean             okay = FALSE;
   22304      177378 :   an_expr_node_ptr      expr;
   22305      177378 :   an_expr_operator_kind op;
   22306      177378 :   an_expr_node_ptr      operand1;
   22307      177378 :   an_operand            orig_operand;
   22308      177378 :   a_boolean             constant_pointer_case = FALSE;
   22309             : 
   22310             :   /* Check for possible misuse of "=" where "==" was intended. */

   22312        8427 :     expr = skip_parens(operand->variant.expression);
   22313        8427 :     if (is_operation_node(expr)) {

   22318             :            "x = constant", which was probably intended to be

   22323             :       }  /* if */
   22324             :     }  /* if */
   22325             :   }  /* if */
   22326             :   /* Force a constant addressing expression to a constant. */
   22327      177378 :   force_operand_to_constant_if_possible(operand);
   22328      177378 :   orig_operand = *operand;
